author: {'steamid': '76561198428695746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1653155374}
review:
[h1]Interesting but Alienating[/h1]
I was gifted this by a friend - And I adore the idea this game is centered around but good lord some aspects could've been handled so much better. I try to aim for 30 hours of playtime (or getting an ending if the amount of content doesn't permit 30 hours) before writing a review, but I really don't think I would've enjoyed going for that long.
Pros:
+ Conceptually, the combat is actually pretty solid! Armed with a bow, a single arrow, and telekinesis to aid in retrieving that arrow, you're tasked with working through a gauntlet of boss fights where you need to land one single shot on the boss' weakpoint to win a given fight. From what I've seen, the bosses all have some pretty unique patterns to them and the intervals of these patterns can be super fast, making the window of opportunity very narrow.
+ From what I remember, every boss seems to have its own track, that's a pretty rare occurrence from my experience! The graphics are pretty good too.
Cons:
- The exact window of opportunity that's presented by a boss isn't always hard to spot, but [i]executing[/i] the steps/motions needed can often be another story. The boss that brick walled me in this way was the [spoiler]Legendary Titan Slayer, who has an electrified arrow that you need to shoot, then retrieve your arrow and shoot at the Slayer himself - I [b]think[/b], I never successfully pulled it off. Might not sound that hard, but keep in mind the window of opportunity is REALLY NARROW.[/spoiler] 
- This game oh-so-desperately needs a quick-retry option. As is, the way respawning plays out is you get killed > screen slowly fades to black > screen slowly fades back in > you're now back at a central checkpoint for a given area, and you have to run back to the arena. I don't mind long respawn times usually, but here, the fact the fading and run-back will almost certainly take up at least 80% of your time making attempts at a boss is horribly imbalanced, that is a ton of dead air.
- My single biggest frustration with this game comes from a self-made rule I have started to call "scheme parity". The basic idea is that every input system that a game supports (keyboard, gamepad, or whatever other weird junk you can think of) should have no substantial advantage or disadvantage over the alternatives available. This game [i]horribly[/i] breaks that rule with its aiming controls. You hold a button down to change the movement controls into aiming controls, and release to fire/go back; on a gamepad, this works just fine as you use an analog stick to move, but on keyboard? You're stuck with the arrow keys. Keep in mind that's only 8 directions keyboard players are allotted, and those other in-between directions are often super important for beating a boss, meaning you're effectively crippled in this game if you so much as lack even a DualShock 3/Sixaxis controller, when they could've incorporated the mouse in some way that doesn't completely tip the scales in its favor. I have been on both sides of this cause the game didn't pick up on my 8bitDo controller when I first tried it, and it really pains me. [strike]This game is almost pay-to-win solely because of an oversight in the controls, how the fu[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068333148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1677269523}
review:
I have some problems with this game, starting with the fact that they don't allow you to modify the controls. Also, being a Boss Rush it is logical that you must follow the pattern, you die - learn - repeat, but this game makes it tedious in a horrible way, every time you die you are sent to a "Checkpoint", from which you must retrace the path, re-enter the dungeon, re-activate the Boss, I know at first it seems silly, but as the game scales in difficulty believe me it becomes very tedious, to the point that it ends up ruining the experience for you. The pixel art is not bad at all, it's simple, but it works, however, the game lacks story as such.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tengo algunos problemas con este juego, empezando por el hecho de que no te permiten modificar los controles. AdemÃ¡s, al ser un Boss Rush es lÃ³gico que debes seguir el patrÃ³n, mueres - aprendes - repites, pero este juego lo hace tedioso de una manera horrible, cada que mueres te mandan a un â€œPunto de controlâ€, desde el cual debes volver a recorrer el camino, volver a entrar a la mazmorra, volver a activar el Boss, sÃ© que al principio parezca una tonterÃ­a, pero conforme el juego escala en dificultad crÃ©eme que se vuelve muy tedioso, al punto que termina de arruinarte la experiencia. El pixel Art no estÃ¡ para nada mal, es simple, pero funciona, sin embargo, el juego carece de historia como tal.

review: I'm not a psychopath. I don't attack creatures who are minding their own business. Not unless given a damn good reason. author: {'steamid': '76561198936354697', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1700948952}
review:
before you buy this game i think i should tell you that is requires a lot of patience and perseverance. The whole premise is that everything goes down in one hit including yourself ,most boss have a weak sot you have to hit in order to do this ( some bosses require additional hits to expose their weak spots ). This can lead lead to a lot of frustration as you would usually know what to do but are unable to do it for what ever reason that occurs.

A controller is highly recommend since the keyboard and mouse controls are awful for this game as they are not remap-able in game. the keyboard and mouse controls use the arrow keys, x and c if i remember correctly which is not they greatest since your now limited to 8 directions toy can shoot your bow ( considering that all the combat is done with your bow this is a massive downside as being able to quickly and accurately land an arrow makes or breaks some fights). with a controller on the other hand the game plays perfectly as you can use the second stick to aim you arrow making they fights a lot easier. 

One other issue i have found which can be very annoying is that the game is tied to your display scaling (on windows settings) which can be a problem for anyone using a display scale that is not 100% as the game doesn't properly scale correctly when its not at 100%. i found this out after upgrading my monitor just to find out that that the is zoomed in at 125% causing it be be unplayable for me. i can also get quite tedious to change the display scale in settings every time you want to play the game so i thought i should mention this in the review.

The world is stunning but empty. they is also no map in game so it can get very hard to navigate too.

The bosses are the reason i keep coming back to this game as they are very unique as they require skill, similar to dark souls where you create a mental game plan and execute it, as your execution is the single most important part of combat. dependent on your skill level this game can be completed in half a hour could take you 10s of hours to complete most fights take 3 minutes max to complete if you know what your doing.

Ignoring the problems i have faced this can me a incredible rewarding and fun game to play if you have to even play though it. i recommend waiting for a sale if you want to pick it up as this game isn't for everyone.

Nesse jogo vocÃª terÃ¡ sua determinaÃ§Ã£o testada, vocÃª pode matar todos seus inimigos com apenas um golpe, mas isso vale para vocÃª tambÃ©m. VocÃª passara por vÃ¡rios titÃ£s, com cada um com seus designer Ãºnico, e com movimentaÃ§Ãµes Ãºnicas, vocÃª terÃ¡ que decorar e aprender como vencer, talvez isso seja de primeira ou talvez demore 30m, vai de cada um. 

Vi algumas pessoas reclamando sobre o fato de nÃ£o ser pratico certas coisas, como por exemplo entrar na sala do boss e essas coisas, e pra mim isso Ã© preguiÃ§a ou vocÃª morreu muito e ta cansado, porem dai Ã© algo da sua experiencia e nÃ£o sinceramente algo ruim do jogo, pelo menos ao meu ver, eu joguei o jogo inteiro e nÃ£o me incomodei em andar um pouco para chegar no boss, nÃ£o acho uma reclamaÃ§Ã£o tÃ£o ruim, porem nÃ£o acho que isso Ã© motivo para o jogo nÃ£o ser considerado bom.

Bem, as musicas desse jogo sÃ£o incrÃ­veis junto com alguns detalhes que vocÃª pode ver e tentar descobrir, ele tem um fator replay interessante para quem se interessa, no qual vocÃª descobre um pouco mais sobre os titÃ£s e por ai vai.

 Eu gosto muito desse jogo e ele pra mim foi um marco por ser muito bom, eu RECOMENDO MUITO, ele Ã© interessante bem feito, com musica, pixel arte atÃ© uma historinha caso queira.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042867551', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1676334370}
review:
Pretty fun short game. Get it on sale or in a bundle.

There are some difficult boss fights, but they can be killed very quickly if you figure out the mechanics. It seems like getting fast 1-cycle kills on bosses is the intended way to play it. The short dodge roll can feel insufficient in long fights with no i-frames versus the bosses' incredibly fast attacks. Finally hitting the boss after lining up their weak spot feels great, though.

Biggest gripes were:
- Aiming could have been better, at times the arrow seemed to fly slightly off from the direction held. 
- WAY too much screen shake with no way to tune it down or turn it off
- Your arrow can get stuck pretty easily behind any obstacle/enemy

author: {'steamid': '76561199030810964', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1691952734}
review: Uno dei migliori indie esistenti.  Non molto lungo ma non un problema per la sua alta difficoltÃ .

author: {'steamid': '76561198027845400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1675794684}
review:
Great but very short game. If you like me dont like running around looking for the bosses and want a more straightforward buss rush experience there is about 2 hours of content here. If you want to explore very thoroughly for every single boss to aim for a true boss clear or do any of the increased difficulty modes then this can last you a while.

Even if it was short to me it was also very sweet, the one hit kill mechanics are very fun to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153475643', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1675790346}
review:
short and cute, makes you a bit mad but you just can't stop playing, hahah. you don't need a controller to beat it all the way if you don't mind having the added difficulty of being able to shoot in only 8 directions (which isn't as bad as it sounds, you just need to think a bit more about positioning yourself and everything around you before shooting).

the bosses are really fun and well designed. if you know exactly what you're doing and get used to dodging you can beat them all super fast. figuring out weakpoints is as easy as trusting your instincts after seeing a single attack cycle or experimenting a little. the downtime after death before you get back to the boss is actually a good addition (there's a single titan you spawn right in front of and the lack of downtime actually wears you out faster!) as it let's you calm down and think of a strategy. and i love love love the lack of repetition in the fights! you never have to repeat the same action 3 times, both you and the bosses are one-shot. 

overall an amazing game for people looking for a challenge <3 if you found hyper light drifter and cuphead fun, this is a good addition to your library, albeit a bit more difficult!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050615144', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1564148564}
review:
Combat is quite good and feels nice difficulty wise and the one arrow mechanic puts an interesting spin on the combat however

walking back every time i die is soul crushingly boring and tedious. taking in the atmosphere and environment isn't so nice after you've done it several times.

I get that you want to punish dying, but in a boss rush game like this where a fight can end within seconds it's just not reasonable to expect the player to walk back every time, dying and not getting progress should be punishment enough.

If you don't have a pet peeve about games wasting your time you'll probably like this game

review: Soy un padre de 50 aÃ±os, probablemente una de las personas mÃ¡s viejas que juegan este juego. Soy padre soltero de mi hijo, que ahora tiene 14 aÃ±os. Mi hijo recientemente descargÃ³ Raft y en menos de una semana, ya habÃ­a jugado durante mÃ¡s de 20 horas. Esto fue terrible para mÃ­, ya que ya era bastante difÃ­cil para mÃ­ pasar tiempo con mi hijo, ya que Ã©l siempre sale con sus amigos o simplemente mira videos en Tiktok. AsÃ­ que decidÃ­ crear una cuenta de Steam y comprar este juego para ver si podÃ­a jugar junto a Ã©l. CarguÃ© el juego, hice el tutorial pero estaba atascado en lo que se suponÃ­a que debÃ­as hacer. Le pedÃ­ ayuda a mi hijo y organizÃ³ un juego para que yo me uniera. Me encantÃ³ porque era el mejor momento que habÃ­a pasado con mi hijo desde que mi esposa habÃ­a muerto. Desde entonces, este juego ha acercado a mi hijo y a mÃ­ nuevamente y ahora tambiÃ©n pasamos tiempo juntos fuera de la casa. Este juego me recordÃ³ que hay diversiÃ³n en todo, y nos ha traÃ­do tanto a mÃ­ como a mi hijo muchos recuerdos felices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979982910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1675317207}
review: This game needs far better movement controls to not drive you insane, given the brilliant run-all-the-way-back-to-the-boss mechanic. Dying because you move like a geriatric slug who has also decided he probably didn't need to learn how to dodge roll & is stuck with the skills of a 3rd grader somersaulting at recess. Pretty frustrating when put on top of having to stand still and wait to use the weakest force-recall of an object that exists in the history of video games. There are some good ideas in here, but they fumbled the core mechanics.

review:
(Mi segna 0.5 ore, non so perchÃ©â€¦)

Ottimo gioco! Non sono dâ€™accordo con chi lo accosta a Dark Souls. Ãˆ molto piÃ¹ simile ad uno Shadow of the Colossus: vaghi un una terra desolata, completamente vuota, in cerca delle anime dei Titani, che abbatti anche se non ti hanno fatto nulla di maleâ€¦

Ogni boss ha una meccanica unica, sempre ben pensata. In ogni combattimento devi studiare lâ€™avversario, morendo varie volte, fino a al momento in cui capisci il suo punto debole, e la volta in cui riesci a sferrare la freccia nel modo giusto, il combattimento si conclude in pochi secondi. Boss secondo me molto belli, il contrario di quelli di alcuni giochi che sono solo sacchetti di punti vita.

review: When I first saw this game, I thought I understood what it was. I dismissed it. I came back after a while and bought it with the understanding that it was not what I thought it was. I played about 37 minutes and then thought it was what I initially thought it was. I did not play again for a few years. I downloaded it again thinking I may have missed something thinking it may not have been what I thought I thought it was and perhaps did not give it a full shake. I think it might understand what it is and I like it, but maybe I will think differently in a year when I try again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011949271', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1674467999}
review: There is an infamous Playstation-exclusive developer by the name of Gilson B Pontes. Every one of his games features the same gameplay loop: you walk around a vast, empty world, until you encounter an enemy which kills you in one hit. The developers of Titan Souls looked at Gilson's work and pondered just what it was that made it so unappealing. Was it the hostile design that delights in wasting the player's time? Was it the lack of things to do in the environment? Was it the barebones, clunky combat mechanics? No! They concluded that the only thing holding Gilson's work back was an ugly aesthetic, which they have replaced with more visually appealing pixel art. Oh, and also you can enjoy firing a single arrow before getting killed in one hit and spending three minutes walking back to the enemy, as opposed to swinging a sword before getting killed in one hit and spending five minutes walking back to the enemy. This is peak innovation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305674799', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1710901520}
review:
Titan Souls. Um jogo excelente e divertido. Minha nota para ele Ã© um 8/10. Este jogo Ã© uma curta e Ã³tima experiÃªncia, mas nÃ£o sendo muito desafiador, funcionando quase como um Boss Rush.

Ele gira em torno de uma mecÃ¢nica onde vocÃª possuiu uma Ãºnica flecha, que depois de atirar ela vocÃª pode recuperar a puxando de volta ou passando por cima dela, e ao decorrer do jogo vocÃª nÃ£o ganha nenhum upgrade ou habilidade nova, nÃ£o tendo nenhuma recompensa quando vocÃª mata um chefe, que na minha opiniÃ£o Ã© bem decepcionante, mas nada que estraga o jogo. Ele possui uma boa quantidade de chefes, cada um tendo uma funcionalidade bem Ãºnica o que deixa o jogo mais interessante no fim, tendo um Ã³timo visual e trilha sonora. 

Titan Souls no final de tudo Ã© um jogo que eu recomendo bastante, porÃ©m acredito que Ã© melhor pegar ele quando estiver em uma boa promoÃ§Ã£o, assim como eu fiz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134987985', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1674263204}
review:
Cool concept, awful execution

The biggest annoyance is that it tries to do the same thing as dark souls by forcing you to run back to the boss room from a checkpoint, but there's no point in it. There are no enemies or tricky platforming or whatever, just nothing. Imagine trying to get better at throwing hoops, but everytime you miss, you have to sit on a bench for 2 minutes before you can try again. It doesn't make you any better at it.

Some bosses are also poorly designed since they either require you to shoot at them twice while they regain their immunity in less than the time it takes for you to retrieve your arrow (yes I tried damaging them by pulling my arrow back, it didn't work and made a clinking sound as if you're hitting a rock or a piece of metal) or have hitboxes that don't correspond to their visuals.

At least the art style is pretty cool and the music and atmosphere is nice, but that's just about everything positive about this game.

It's just a massive slog

author: {'steamid': '76561199156337224', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1698505905}
review:
Si tuviese que describir este juego en una sola palabra, serÃ­a minimalismo. Es increÃ­ble como en 3-4 horas y UN punto principal, consigue divertir y variar tanto.

BÃ¡sicamente va de una persona cualquiera que se encuentra en un vasto mundo lleno de titanes, criaturas mucho mÃ¡s imponentes y aparentemente poderosas que Ã©l. Al mÃ¡s puro estilo Shadow of the Collosus, iremos derrotando a distintos titanes con nuestra Ãºnica arma, el arco. El combate es el focus del juego.  Este es fluÃ­disimo, es sÃºper gratificante simplemente combatir, aunque te mueras. El movimiento estÃ¡ sÃºper bien hecho y el arco se maneja muy bien.

Los bosses, lo principal... Son perfectos. Simplemente eso. Los combates tienen 2 fases: la primera, encontrar el punto dÃ©bil y la segunda a darle al punto dÃ©bil. Eso hace que los primeros intentos de un jefe, Ã©l se sienta desconocido, ya que no sabes quÃ© hay que hacer realmente. Consiguen que de una flecha salgan varias mecÃ¡nicas bastante originales y divertidas.

Visualmente, es muy bonito, con entornos variados y un pixel art simple pero muy bonico. La mÃºsica es como yo lo llamo "hacer un Breath of The Wild". Esto es no poner mÃºsica en el overworld y en los combates poner para que sean mÃ¡s Ã©picos, y lo hace muy bien. Transmite muy bien esa sensaciÃ³n de soledad ante un mundo tan grande.

Titan Souls me ha parecido un juegardo en toda regla que todo el mundo deberÃ­a jugar aunque fuera solo una vez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218485847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1673697875}
review:
Short, simple action roguelite game with a cryptic barebones story. Pretty good pixelart with large expansive world, which is quite underutilized. It almost felt like the map is padding out the actual gameplay a bit too much. Armed with a bow and a single arrow that can be recalled back to you, you face off against the titular titans. Every titan has a unique approach to killing them. Figuring out each titan's weakness and the optimal strategy requires multiple tries. Unfortunately, there's no instant restart mechanism for the battles. Note that some of the titans are optional, including some hidden behind some simple puzzles.

Recommended if you can be patient enough with the game (I died around 200 times for 1 playthrough).

Redeemed the game for free as a limited-time promo when the developers released Death's Door, which is a sequel to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983145909', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1673713244}
review:
Game focuses on screen shaking and clunky movement mechanics to pose a challenge.
My eyes get really tierd with the constant shaking, while also having to keep track of everything. Basically increasing the difficulty by putting a hand infront of your face. Feels cheap.

Games where movement is an important aspect dose not benefit from dodge while aproaching a wall or stairs to knock you back. Making you lose control of your character. One of the earlier bosses uses a pushback effect while a pike is chasing you which knocks you back if it hits and stuns you for a breif moment if you are knocked into a wall dead, if you are hit by projectile you are also dead. Movement is important, but dose feel cluncky. All this while of course there is screen shaking and particle effects.

One redeming factor to this game is that most encounters requires you to do what is right just once to kill the boss. Avoiding the concept of bulletsponge type of bosses.

review:

Frustante Ã© uma das palavras que da pra definir esse jogo, sua simplicidade na gameplay nÃ£o impede de inovar em cada boss battle que em resumo se basei em tentativa e erro, cabendo ao jogador ter a forÃ§a de vontade e paciÃªncia (muita inclusive) pra avanÃ§ar no jogo. Tenho certo ranÃ§o dos controles que nÃ£o sÃ£o muito precisos pra esse tipo de jogo.

 O jogo Ã© extremamente bonito e charmoso ao seu modo, o mapa bonito e contemplativo ajuda a embelezar a experiÃªncia e passar a vibe do game. A OST Ã© muito boa e pra min brilha bem mais nos momentos de interlÃºdio da ida de um lugar para o outro. A histÃ³ria Ã© contada pelos lugares e cenÃ¡rios, poucos sÃ£o os personagens que tem dialogo, tornando tudo extremamente interpretativa, oque eu pessoalmente gosto.

 Por fim, recomendo pra quem curte jogos difÃ­ceis e que exigem muito do jogador (perfect time, bons reflexos e paciÃªncia). Bom jogo.

7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1673417823}
review:
A game on the wrong side of hard. Armed with one move - shooting an arrow - you set out to take down a myriad of bosses. No story, barely any music and somewhat pretty pixel art give you guidance.

I fought about 8 bosses or so, and that was all I needed to see. The interesting part is that most bosses can be killed very quickly with some good aim as they only need one or two shots to die. I find it very intriguing to have bosses that are just as weak and fragile as the player, but the execution leaves a bit to be desired. The problem starts with the bosses that take more than one shot or have a weak point that is very weird or awkward to hit. One example is the water snake boss, which has a weak point at its tail. I could swear I hit that point dozens of times and eventually it registered, but it's very finnicky. Other bosses require you to either read the developers minds or almost feel like you have to abuse the shoot mechanic to hit their weak point.

The game also lacks some severe impact. The sound effects are flat, and while taking down a boss by shooting a precise spot can be fulfilling, it is absolutely not reflected in the presentation. Shooting the bow just feels weak and everything seems floaty.

The gimmick of only bosses becomes old very quick, though, and if you are not an elite pro gamer or have impeccable aim (of firing an arrow with a very narrow hitbox while having to dodge), the game will quickly become frustrating. Even aside from that, though, I think the pixel art is a bit flat and doesn't have enough depth to keep the game interesting to look at and the music is either nonexistent or barely there. Sadly, this all accumulates in a severe lack of atmosphere and after killing 8 or so bosses, I had enough. Worth a look if the concept sounds interesting to you, but DEFINITELY not for full price and only if you have a lot of patience, though personally I will not recommend it. Then again, I suck!

review: The game feels empty. It looks great if you like pixel art but it just dumps you in and you fight bosses. You get one hit. That't it. You are little Mario with no mushroom in sight the entire beginning. It doesn't feel rewarding to beat a boss. There isn't any customization. For 2 dollars, the game would be great. for 15, it is far too overpriced for me to recommend in good conscience. Any of the souls games or their spin-offs are just as difficult but far more enjoyable and rewarding.

review: Mark Foster, David Fenn, and Andrew Gleeson, what happened to you all to create such an unforgiving masterpiece? Why would you release this punishing iron maiden of gaming into the world? Anyway, I'm off to play Death's Door now.

review:
This game is wayyy harder than it looks, and despite that, all the wacky bosses make this game really fun.
Despite how the game might appear, this game is also really fun, and even though I have to read all the quick-kill guides to find a way to beat the hard as hell bosses, this game is a definite buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022182848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1672395193}
review:
One hit KO for you and the boss. The entire game is just a small fantasy map with no enemies, and some souls-like save points spread out, each save point near a number of boss doors. You have a bow and single arrow that you can recall after shooting, which leaves you vulnerable. You can roll, and run. It's a lot like shadow of the colossus, simplified and with a souls-like save point system. Some bosses are frustrating to figure out wtf to do to kill it, but the majority are not too difficult. You will die, a lot, but save points are close to boss doors. I'm fighting the last boss right now (giving the game a break for the night), and I'm over 100 deaths. The only fault of this game is that you might figure out the correct solution to killing a boss, but miss slightly with your arrow many times, and then you might start trying another tactic because you think your strategy was wrong, when in fact it was the right strategy all along (you were just not hitting the spot exactly where the hit box was). This happened twice to me, so if you think you know the correct solution, stick with your gut. Overall, I give this game 8/10. It's a good and relatively difficult boss killing game.

Edit: Just beat the game, all bosses, 258 total deaths xD

review:
It was a bit shorter than I was expecting. Sure, there's some replayability with harder new game+ modes, but that doesn't interest me so much.

The gameplay was also much more abrupt than I was expecting. With comparisons to Dark Souls I was expecting chipping away at their health, but you die in one hit and so do the bosses (in most cases). So there are some times where you start a boss fight and it only lasts about 5 seconds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363680967', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1710821391}
review:
I like hard bosses, and this had them.
Interesting mechanic, however:
You 1-shot every phase of every boss.* Your bow also can be dragged in, and some of the achievements even have you use this mechanic, sometimes even for a achievement. Overall, it's a somewhat hard boss rush game with nearly nothing else. I liked it, and the bosses were so cool and memorable. But it's only that.

*Sometimes to hit the bosses core you have to break the boss apart, shoot a tooth, etc...

review: Very simple graphics and good music. Easy to know what to do. But it is very hard game that has much challenge! You die on one hit so you need be very carefull on what you do. Many bosses are very very hard and sometimes you only beat them on luck. It is not relaxing game but very good for trying your skill and feels good to win hard bosses. It is fun to try figure out what works to kill boss.

review:
Corto , pero difÃ­cil. Titan Souls es un juego del estilo "Boss rush" muy simple pero muy bien ejecutado con rasgos muy similares al gran Shadow of the Colossus. Tan simple que tenemos dos Ãºnicas acciones , lanzar/recoger nuestra flecha y esquivar. Con solo estas dos simples acciones , Acid Nerve consiguiÃ³ crear un ambiente de juego mÃ¡s desafÃ­ante de lo que puede parecer en un principio. 

La mecÃ¡nica principal del juego es que cada boss que nos vamos a encontrar posee un punto dÃ©bil , y nos bastarÃ¡ con un Ãºnico flechazo para acabar con Ã©l. 

Puede parecer sencillo dicho de esta forma , pero los 20 bosses que dispone Titan Souls tienen diseÃ±os originales y se nos va a hacer difÃ­cil saber realmente como acabar con ellos.

Todo esto acompaÃ±ado de un pixel art bastante simpatico y una mÃºsica muy notable. 

Muy recomendable para las casi 4 horitas que me ha durado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022534688', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1671135687}
review: Metric-ton-of-crap: The Game! ANY game that doesn't allow you to customize your KB+M keybinds (and "strongly recommends a gamepad"), while requiring precise movement due to how difficult it is, cannot be good no matter how much you white-knight it for whatever reason. If you require skill from the player, at least let him customize his controls so he can comfortably give his 100% without the necessity to conform with playing on exclusively KB+M OR gamepad, just because "that is how the game is designed". I cannot, for the love of me, play this game on gamepad, and since KB+M custom keybinds are absent I am literally unable to finish this game (and to those "git gud on gamepad" clowns, I say - get a life, touch some grass! Just because you are skilled with a gamepad does not mean that I - or anyone who grew-out of gamepad phase since KB+M is vastly supperior - should tryhard to master using it so I could beat a game.)

review: Fun, then frustrating, then eventually satisfying, as with most games of its type. There's no energy wasted in this game--it's mainly just a sequence of bosses, with the odd puzzle. Very pleasant world to be in when you're not trying to kill massive lumps of rock with a puny bow and arrow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1670207450}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - Seriously Flawed â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†â˜†[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1] 
At one point, it seemed like Titan Souls (TS) was this exciting, up and coming game. You'd go up against epic bosses and uncover secrets about this interesting world. Sometime after it launched, the interest seemed to fade fast. A flash in the pan experience. Regardless, I can't believe it released seven years ago, back in 2015. Either way, it's time to see if these titans have soul. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
TS has a rather simple concept. Each boss dies from one shot of your arrow. What you have to figure out is how to survive their own attacks so you can set up that death strike. There's no peons, RPG elements, shops, or other distractions. It's very streamlined and to the point. I wouldn't say any of the fights are a puzzle per se, but some require a bit of thinking or clever interaction in order to create that opening. For instance, using your ability to call your arrow to you in order to strike them from behind. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2897602164
[h1]Controls[/h1] 
Although the developers recommend playing TS with a controller, I saw some comments on how they beat it just fine with a keyboard. For me, moving and aiming in tandem with each other would be too much for me to manage that way, so I relied on my controller. One thing I wasn't fond of was not being able to run without rolling first. It seems like that would have been possible to account for with unused buttons on the controller. 


[h1]Story[/h1] 
Honestly, TS gives me the impression of a game the developers hoped would come across as really mysterious and clever, without earning it. Putting a player into an unexplained situation with sparse bread crumbs doesn't create a compelling world or scenario. If anything, I just think you couldn't bother coming up with your own lore, hoping I'd fill in the gaps. My only thought is whether some Crystal Gems got lost, because there's quite a few rock people here. 

One of the more disappointing â€œfightsâ€ for me was The First Soul, as he's the only titan that speaks with you. It gives a small glimpse as to what the character's intent might be, but not enough to clear matters up or explain what's happening, let alone why. What annoyed me about it most of all was that it felt somewhat like I was being lectured before putting down a stray dog, except I have no other recourse unless I wanted to stop playing the game. â€œYou're such a tormented soul, but also selfish and foolish. Go ahead though, kill me. Absorbing my power is more important than the sanctity of life.â€ I mean, you're a sentient mountain with nobody to talk to, so I'm probably doing you a favor anyways. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2897602425
[h1]Visuals[/h1] 
Your view of the action in TS is from an overhead angle, and at a distance as well, which makes your character quite small on the screen. This is to accommodate the boss arenas and their large size, so you have time to respond to their attacks. I wouldn't say it's hard to keep track of your character, but being able to determine your position in relation to the weak spot and charge and line up your shot accurately isn't inherently easy. If there was any meaning or purpose behind it, the landscapes and environments would be more pleasurable to look at, because they're well made. They look serene while also having a sense of scale and grandeur about them. However, since they're open and barren, with no story-telling elements taking place, it only wastes time before you get to fight the next titan. 


[h1]Sound Design[/h1] 
This will sound odd, but although TS has some really engaging and snappy songs, it's not really much of a benefit. Each boss having a compelling tune doesn't mean much when you aren't in the fight long enough to hear the whole song. Quite a few bosses can kill you within a few seconds, and you won't hear the song again until after you've walked all the way back. If the song continued on as you respawned and started the fight over again it would work much better, giving players a chance to hear these tunes. The sounds of the titans' attacks also tends to drown out the music. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2897601891
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
ğŸŒŸ The boss designs aren't as varied as I'd have hoped. I saw quite a few stone figures and faces after all. How you beat each of them is more distinct though, so it somewhat makes up for that. 
ğŸŒŸ Conceptually, I like the idea of the player and boss being equally vulnerable. One shot will kill both. I just don't love the execution. 


[h1]Cons[/h1] 
âŒ Your window of opportunity on some bosses is very small or can be made more complicated because of other factors. For instance, stunning Knight Elhanan by shooting his magic arrow isn't too hard. However, retrieving your arrow and hitting him before his armor rejuvenates means that stunning him might be a waste of your time if those other factors aren't ideal. 
âŒ The intention of TS doesn't seem to be one where you engage in a battle for minutes, bobbing and weaving while waiting for your opportune moment. It's more like they were meant to be cheesed, as a few achievements show. 


[h1]Tips[/h1]
ğŸ” On the Yeti fight, I found that hitting him after his first wall charge was much harder than it seems because the timing is so precise. Swerve to the right and back left so he charges two more times, and he'll be much easier to hit then. 
ğŸ” I'd suggest watching video guides on how to beat the bosses quickly. Sometimes it's a bit obtuse how you're meant to make them vulnerable, and brute forcing the solution would be obnoxious. 


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1] 
As someone who enjoys a good boss fight, I'd have thought a boss gauntlet like this would have appealed to me more. However, the developers made some odd choices in the design that wound up doing nothing to make TS more appealing. Creating beautiful scenery is pointless when players have no idea about the location they're in. 

Why are these titans clustered so close to one another? It makes killing them all convenient, but I've no idea what my reason for doing so is. Plus, what moron decided I needed to take a 20 second walk before retrying the boss after each death? Of course I'm going to search for the easy way to cheese your boss fights if you don't respect my time. With that in mind, I don't recommend TS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010335843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1674633988}
review:
There's something very wrong with this game. A one hit death mechanic done right is something like Celeste or Super Meat Boy, which are fast-pased and get you back in the action right away as soon as you die. This game's one hit death is pointless. They COULD give you a life bar, they just choose not to to make the game arbitrarily more time-consuming. They COULD start you back at the boss as soon as you die, but they choose to make you walk back. They COULD allow you to move when you try to retrieve your knife, but they choose to make the game clunky by forcing you to stand still.

It's not that this game is just bad, it's that it's deliberately made to be a waste of time. The fun : time spent ratio in this game is very low.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332849567', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1669603759}
review:
To me the game didn't seem like fun. I opened the first gates, but then got a boss that was a skull cube with 2 morning stars in the fire portion of the map and after several attempts I couldn't care less to try again.

The boss has to be hit into a small spot on the back and with a preset angle (with a 45 degree step), it quickly turned into a game of luck hoping that the angle I am shooting at will match the angle of the boss' rotation and possition in that moment.

Another annoying part is that running takes time, respawn animation and fading screen after death takes time. After the open gates the area i vast and I had to play hide and seek with the bosses and it just immediately started to feel like a waste of time.

You should have continued with the same design of "caves" as the starting 4 bosses and not try to complicate it by creating a world that has nothing in it but tiles of different colors.

review: My biggest inspiration for when I create my own video game <3.  Only patient gamers will beat this one.  It takes a lot of dedication to memorize each bosses patterns and master the simple but stretched out combat.  The music, sprite work, bosses, level design, combat design and overall game feel are just so amazing.  Dark Souls players especially will feel at home with this one, give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198283556137', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1695995037}
review:
without some sort of direct lore, the game play was quite intuitive. fighting bosses with different strategies required for each makes one look forward to the next; as such i couldn't leave until i beat titan souls. as per its price, waiting for half price or on the often off-chance of its 90% off sales would be advised to save a few bucks; as the game-play for me was 2 hours on first completion without prior knowledge of the games' mechanics.

i personally didn't get heated towards this game, as each boss and learning its attack patterns took all my preoccupation.
play time is short, so wouldn't drop a $20.

ill see you on the finish line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019647868', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1669516899}
review:
Fun..ish? Bosses are good, music and art is all nice, gameplay is largely fine. It took me less than 4 hours to get the true ending on my first run, which isn't great for a $15 game. Most of the time is spent running back and forth between different areas, and back to where the boss is after dying. It takes about 7 seconds just to respawn on top of that. It's bearable for one playthrough, but then there's modifiers on top of that. They make the game harder in various ways, and as a result just make the aforementioned issues much more apparent.

Normally if a game has a deathless achievement I'd do it legit, having completed Hollow Knight steel soul runs with over 100% completion twice, or going for golden strawberries in Celeste, but at this point I'm just going to savescum the last few achievements so I don't have to run around for 10 minutes each attempt, and forget about this game forever. Not worth the $15 imo, only get it on sale or if they make it free again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202141575', 'num_games_owned': 2593, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1668804559}
review:
you better know what you are getting into . 
but i do recommend this , IF
1. you enjoy really difficult games 
2. you don't mind some fights and mechanics being really annoying
3. you are just looking for bossfights ; there is no story or lore to speak of
4. know and accept that it will feel like you are just running from the checkpoint to battles half the time ; there is a fair bit of downtime
5. you have a controller or are okay with the game being a bit clumsy on keyboard 

it is a well made boss-crawler , not amazing or anything , but if you know it is what you are looking for , go for it

author: {'steamid': '76561198038894658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1651800409}
review: A quirky game with some nice bosses and overall visuals, but ultimately the only reason I endured it was because it's a prequel of sorts to the studio's amazing Death's Door game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069369321', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1668555163}
review: The idea is good, but the game really needs to refine its mechanics. The movement is just a little too clunky and I wish restarting a fight was as quick as dying in one was. The fading screen transitions and the walk towards the boss room get grating really fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076678939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1668476553}
review: Fantastic visuals, but believe it or not, getting insta-killed by a single mistake isn't fun. If the resets were as fast as Celeste, I could have fun, but because you have to manually run for several seconds to get back into the bossroom before you can start the challenge over again, it gets frustrating really quickly. 10 seconds doesn't seem that long, but when you have it so that one mistake instakills you, minimizing frustration should be a priority.

author: {'steamid': '76561199125496141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1668457733}
review:
Das Spielprinzip ist wirklich sehr gut und die Boss kÃ¤mpfe sind bestimmt (weil ich noch nicht viel gespielt hab) sehr anspruchsvoll.
Leider kann man das Spiel mit der Tastatur kaum spielen und die Steuerung auch nicht um belegen. Mann kann das Spiel jedoch mit einem Controller spielen, was das Ganze deutlich angenehmer macht.
Wenn man einen Controller hat sollte man sich dieses Spiel im Angebot mal anschauen.
Falls man bei Getting over it schon mentale Probleme bekommen hat wÃ¼rde ich dieses Spiel jedoch nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006539860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1668435569}
review:
Arrow retrieval is not a fun mechanic.

Running back to bosses after being instakilled is not a fun use of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075448698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1669436376}
review:
Such an underrated masterpiece. The game is short but it's fun. I think it's similar to Elden Ring, you are free to choose which boss you want to destroy first. It's light, challenging, and you need to think creatively for each boss fight. Playing it in hard mode would give a brand new experience. The music score for each region fits the mood perfectly. Boss fight soundtrack totally slaps. Definitely worth the price. 

Remember,  the special trait of this game is that you only have one ammunition - one arrow, so make sure to only release it when it counts! 9/10

I would not recommend this game to people with slow reflexes and who doesn't like the thrill of adrenaline, this game is for people who enjoys looking for ways to kill the boss while evading dozens of projectiles and the bosses trying to stomp, roll, crush, slice, incinerate your tiny character. but if you are a masochist psycho then this game is for you.

review: It's a delightful little game, and feels incredibly rewarding to beat. All bosses are designed to be one-shotted, and each battle can be over in seconds. Conversely, you can be killed in one shot. The game takes a tiny bit of patience and observing skills, and then you'll topple the titans one at a time. The surprise secret boss was a real treat and I loved its inspirations. So glad I gave this game a fair try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888370', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 4055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4055, 'last_played': 1624156490}
review:
Titan Souls is pretty much a kind of pixilated Dark Souls.

One of the most challenging pixel games Iâ€™ve ever played, with a phenomenal visual concept. One of the few games Iâ€™ve played, that I ended up loving, but will never play again.

As neckbeardy as it may sound, playing Titan Souls made me feel like a matador.

After getting my butt kicked multiple times, I had to reassess how I was playing the game. After a while things started to click, and it became a really satisfying and calming combat experience.

Still, the brutal difficulty is balanced by the immediacy with which you are given a chance to learn from your mistakes, and this game doesnâ€™t understand that concept at all due to the run back mechanic. 

Itâ€™s Zelda 2 levels of archaic. After beating it I decided Iâ€™ll never touch this game again due to how much this game wastes your time.

Itâ€™s still worth checking out at least once, specially when it goes for sale for super cheap. Good game for ruining your life if you suffer form anger management. At least itâ€™s cheaper than cocaine.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073332036', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1667787245}
review:
In this nicely presented yet barren world where 3d and 2d blend seamlessly to create, sadly, such a [b]boring[/b] game. It's a boss rush game and you spend most of your time running back to the boss room. I have so far played about 2 hours and 40 minute and in that time I killed 8 bosses for I'd say total of 25 minutes of actual fight. Rest was mindlesly running from spawn to room ad nauseam. [i]To devs; If your only punishment for death is tedium, perhaps consider better rewards than the relief of being done with a particular boss just so you don't have to walk the same path for the umpteenth time.[/i] 

+Unique boss designs. Figuring out how to stay alive long enough to find that one very short window of opportunity to beat a boss was enjoyable.
+Art is pretty to look at, though bit bland in some parts.
+Controller rumbles are beautifully utilized.

-No other weapons, which would be fine had the only weapon in the game felt satisfying to use. There is no indicator for where you're aiming other than the tiniest of gray triangle at the tip of your arrow.
-No visual progression either. 
-No cutscenes or story bites. (other than the animation that plays when you defeat a boss which I admit is quite satisfying for the first few times.)
-Absolutely horriblly implemented dodge roll and sprint mechanic. Movement in general feels clunky and unsatisfying. You can't sprint without rolling first, heck most of the time you're not even sure if you're sprinting because there is literally no sprite change to your character. I shouldn't have to ask "am I still sprinting?" in the middle of chaos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147741007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1667806402}
review:
I paid around $3.50 and still feel like a waste of money. If you tell me this is a project for a portfolio... its nice... Beautiful Pixel Art and Music; But gameplay is boring and tedious.

-Literally just 1 arrow, thats all.
-The dash is not precise... the whole control is not precise...
-The map is beautiful... BUT ITS EMPY.
-Checkpoints are so far from the Titans that each time you die (and you die a lot), you need to walk all over again to the titan's cave... Literally 70% of gameplay is walking over and over for the same place because you die.
-There is no pause...
-No map or indication where are the rest of titans. Exloration as excuse? well... its it wasn't an empty and boring world... would be a nice idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053053672', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1647743939}
review: I personally don't actually like the game much, but respect it. It's well made but I can't deal with the downtime commute between retries and fights. Where I can deal with Dark Souls bc of the time to kill and flexibility of approach or Hotline Miami bc of how fast it is to die but almost faster to jump right back, Titan Souls lets the time between your revival and reattempt REALLY sink in. Again, it's well made, the atmosphere, controls, and fights are nice, but it's an inverse of what I prefer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455758', 'num_games_owned': 1566, 'num_reviews': 1960, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1460817216}
review:
Great idea. But everything is spoiled by a terrible implementation. The character control is rather clumsy, there are few game mechanics, and the mechanics themselves are rather boring.

Also, there is very little content. Combined with the fact that you have to die over and over again, in the same places, this makes the game disgusting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001025729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1666903969}
review:
Good premise and idea, dogshit execution. The game somehow manages to have only 3 game mechanics (Dodge, shoot and retrieve) and none of them feel remotely polished. You will constantly fight against the game's jank instead of making use of the game mechanics. Hard pass.

Also the hitboxes are so bad you'd almost think this was a Capcom game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033623422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1666353797}
review:
Not for me.

This game condenses all the frustration of dying over and over in boss fights down into a minimal viable game. 

Most of the game value seems to be doing the same content over and over again but at harder difficulties, and I just struggle to be motivated to meet that challenge when there are so many more rewarding games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968634862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1666013408}
review:
I really love the concept of this game, many bosses with unique fight and a way to kill, and u have to discover how to beat him.

Well. the problem here is this is very easy game, u need like 2-5 try just to figure out how to beat the boss, and u'll not spend more than 2-10 min "in maximum" to kill a boss, and that's mean u gonna beat the game in just 2-3h like i did.

2- Severe Lack Of Content: to reach each boss the only thing u have to do is just walking to, i wish like there's a puzzle to solve before you can enter to fight the boss.

Yes i enjoy it, but still cant recommended with this price. not worth. 4.99$ would be fair, not more.

author: {'steamid': '76561199406064304', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1682450696}
review:
Haven't beaten this game yet, but I am liking it so far. The atmosphere is good, the soundtrack is even better, and it is SO satisfying to kill a boss you've died to multiple times. 

Would recommend if you like a tough challenge.

EDIT: Just beat the game, and lemme tell ya, I'm nervous about how hard the other three modes are gonna be. Still enjoyed the experience either way!

EDIT 2: Beat it once more on hard mode, and forgot that I had to slay every titan to fight against TRUTH. Did it on my normal save file and h o l y   s h i t

review:
Estuvo gratis en Steam y me enganchÃ³ hasta que me lo pasÃ©. El juego serÃ­a una versiÃ³n en pixel art e isomÃ©trica de Shadow of the Colossus pero con una mecÃ¡nica curiosa, ya que la Ãºnica arma que podemos usar es un arco con una sola flecha la cual podemos atraer una vez lanzada, y ademÃ¡s tiene mecÃ¡nicas one hit tanto para el jugador como para los enemigos (que solo son titanes, sin haber minions ni cosas parecidas). 

Aunque todos los enemigos tienen un punto dÃ©bil la verdad es que el juego te exige en algunas ocasiones de una rapidez de reflejos y punterÃ­a que aÃ±aden dificultad de forma artificial (para 13 titanes morÃ­ mÃ¡s de 200 veces, y eso que no habÃ­a que derrotar a todos para completar el juego). 

El apartado artÃ­stico tanto visual como sonoro me parecieron de 10 y la historia, como todo juego tipo "souls" (que de souls solo tiene los jefes y la dificultad) que se precie, es enrevesada y estÃ¡ escrita entre lÃ­neas. SegÃºn vi en internet, el final del juego se me bugueÃ³ y no pude luchar contra el jefe secreto del final, pero tampoco me voy a complicar la vida con eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010037753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1663959299}
review:
The basic idea is fine, the problem is that the game loves to waste your time.

Most fights are over very, very quickly, either because you killed the boss or (more often), the boss killed you. You're gonna die a lot.

That's not inherently a bad thing, but when you die, you get sent back to a checkpoint that is probably 10-30 seconds away from starting the fight again. So you end up spending somewhere between a third and half of your playtime running back to the boss. It gets old really, REALLY fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113388537', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1663513698}
review:
[h1] One hit is all I need [/h1]

Titan Souls is a well crafted Boss Rush Game which offers a unique twist. Both you and the Boss are one hit away from dying. And all you got is a bow with one arrow. Well to be honest some bosses require more than one hit to kill, since they hide or protect there weak spot. But none the less everything dies from just one hit. 
So you find yourself walking are world in between worlds made by one protect by many. All you need to do is walk the path and kill all titans. The overworld offers nothing but walking, which can be annoying. Sometimes you end up dying in a fight and you have to walk from the Checkpoint that is a little further away. If you died like the 10th time at the same boss and you have to walk the same path the 10th times, I presume i dont have to tell you how annoying that could be. 
I tell you this first because this is what felt bad. It is one of two things i dont like about the game. The second being the worst game decison of all time. So Imagine when walking the 10th time all the way to the titan that you seemingly cant kill. And you can roll which allows you to not only dodge but to move quicker. After rolling you end up in a sprint. The worst enemy of rolling are stairs. You cant roll upstairs. Sounds stupid. And yeah in real life rolling upstairs is not a usual way of moving on stairs, but here you bounce off back were you came from. No tie things together. You died another time, maybe a mistake you did. You know next time it will be the death of the titan. You have it on your fingers, you know exacatly what to do. And you spawn, you want get to the titan as fast as possible. An you press rolling. And well the is a stairs. Because you climb a mountain and a tower and everything is elevated. And you bounce back, back to the checkpoint. I got pissed several times. Hate it.

Gladly this is the only thing i hated. Other then that it is a great game. Each titan offers a unique challenge. A different fighting style forcing you to adapt and overcome him, in order to get the killing blow. The visuals are stunning. And I have been blown away by some animations. The music does its job pretty well. Some fights have forgetable music others have incredible music. Most memorable for me the final fight against the Soul and the Titan Slayer. If you dive deeper into the story, which is not obviously told, you find a unique perspective rarly seen. Even so one of my favorite animes has it. It is worth to slay all titans. And to slay a titan is an incredible feeling. The moment the arrow hits and everything stops and you are only left by silence judging you and what you did. Except for the times when the arrow is stuck between the butt cheeks of a yet or in the crotch of a knight. Not that plesant. 

For me this games comes with the one thing i love. Storytelling. Its not obvious and it leaves room for interpretation. But discovery is rare and rewarded. The Game Loop works. It takes it Artstyl into count. Using it to make an incredible experience rounded by a Soundtrack that has memorable tracks. 
So for me? I move over to Deaths Door another game made by the same developer. Which somewhat or somehow plays in the same world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299569581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1623871126}
review:
Gra z typu tych trudnych, nawet bardzo trudnych. Wchodzisz na arenki, walczysz z bossami i jeÅ›li ich pokonasz to przechodzisz dalej. Dla mnie gra zbyt trudna, ale jest do przejÅ›cia bo koledze udalo sie to zrobiÄ‡. I tak od siebie to polecam graÄ‡ na padzie, nie klawiaturze. Poza tym gra wedlug mnie jest Å›wietnie wykonana, lecz jestem na NiÄ… za sÅ‚aby. Polecam! I polecam zaÅ¼ywaÄ‡ leki na nerwy przed.

A game of the difficult, even very difficult type. You enter arenas, fight bosses and if you defeat them, you move on. For me the game is too difficult, but it is manageable because my friend managed to do it. I recommend playing the pad, not the keyboard, anyway. Besides, the game is great in my opinion, but I'm too weak for it. I recommend! And I recommend taking nerve medication before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287999349', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1662927007}
review:
[h1] RESUMO: [/h1] 

Um jogo do estilo "Soulslike" em 2D, onde o protagonista mata Bosses por motivos desconhecidos.

[h1] GRÃFICOS/ESTÃ‰TICA: [/h1] 

O jogo Ã© colorido, com bom ambiente e atÃ© tem alguma variedade de biomas, mas Ã© um mapa muito grande que ficou completamente vazio, com escadas que levam a sÃ­tios sem absolutamente nada. Os criadores tentaram fazer um jogo "grande" mas faltou inspiraÃ§Ã£o e criatividade para acrescentar detalhamento ao mapa.

[h1] GAMEPLAY: [/h1] 

A gameplay Ã© super simples com basicamente 2 controlos. O jogo baseia-se num menino com um arco e flecha que tem que matar Bosses para progredir no mapa. Para deixar o jogo difÃ­cil, o menino sÃ³ tem 1 flecha que consegue disparar e apanhar de volta para efetuar o prÃ³ximo disparo. TambÃ©m temos somente 1 vida, ou 1 de HP, ou seja, cada golpe que sofremos Ã© mortal e faz-nos ter que recomeÃ§ar a batalha. Os criadores do jogo acharam super divertido fazer com que cada vez que morremos, temos que fazer meia maratona e correr meio mapa para voltar a repetir a batalha o que Ã© completamente sem sentido e estÃºpido. E o pior Ã© que temos que fazer isto com 19 bosses, ou seja, repetitivo e frustrante. Para alÃ©m disso, nÃ£o existe qualquer tipo de progressÃ£o no jogo, acabamos o jogo basicamente como comeÃ§amos. 

[h1] EXPLORAÃ‡ÃƒO: [/h1] 

NÃ£o existe qualquer tipo de exploraÃ§Ã£o, apesar de ter um mapa gigante que falha por ser completamente vazio.

[h1] HISTÃ“RIA/NARRATIVA: [/h1] 

Negativamente, o jogo nÃ£o possui histÃ³ria nenhuma. Ã‰ um jogo em que um simples menino com um arco e flecha, mata monstros porque lhe apetece.

[h1] MULTIPLAYER: [/h1] 

O jogo Ã© estritamente Singleplayer.

[h1] PREÃ‡O: [/h1] 

O jogo foi oferecido gratuitamente pela Steam, mas honestamente Ã© o tipo de jogo que se eu soubesse que era assim nÃ£o tinha jogado nem que me pagassem. Ã‰ escusado dizer que 14,99â‚¬ por isto, Ã© o maior roubo da histÃ³ria.

[h1] NOTA FINAL: 2/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043268673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1662563239}
review:
This is a boss rush game and it has [b]absolutely no resemblance to souls-likes[/b]. I think tag is doing this game a disservice, because people come looking for features that are just not there.

[h1]Not a souls-like[/h1]
It's difficult and it features a dodge-roll mechanic - that's where similarities to souls-likes end. Souls-likes are about reading the boss, (usually) managing stamina and surviving the fight. Souls-like fights usually give you plenty of time to make mistakes, so you have to know the enemies well to succeed. 

This game is about landing 1 attack. You can see the boss for the first time, get 1 lucky shot and win. 1 strike of luck is not something that can beat a souls-like boss.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Character mechanics
[list]
[*] Shooting button charges and releases and arrow, and once you shoot it, you hold it to retrieve it.
[*] Roll button rolls, and you can hold it to run. 
[*] 1 HP - instant-death mode.
[/list]

The entire gameplay loop is you figuring out the boss's weakspot and finding an opening to attack it (1 hit kills the boss). It's definitely a difficult action game, and I would maybe even label it a puzzle game due to some some bosses.

[h1]The running.....[/h1]
It's a game where you die in 1 hit and you keep dying until you figure out a way to fight back. You have to run to a boss room after each death. 

Why devs chose to make players run from a checkpoint after each death is beyond me... IMO that is a ridiculous choice that wastes the players time and adds nothing but frustration to the game. Couple that with the fact that the character bumps into the straits when attempting to roll (faster than walking) up them and frustration levels increase exponentially.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
I'm sure there's a market for this game, but I'm not a part of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408013437', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1662425518}
review: This is an awesome little game with some really cool ideas. The combat is super simple but the game makes use of it well in a variety of ways. The boss designs were really unique even if some were somewhat reminiscent of others. It really feels like a shorter, 2D Shadow of the Colossus. I don't think its length is necessarily a bad thing (3-5 hrs), but its a little short for a $15 game, but on sale its a great deal. High replayability for fans of speed running.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115384738', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1662554284}
review:
"Boss rush, but no rush, and only boss." - Tony Bon Jony

This game borrows the 'walking back to the boss arena,' 'slamming the controller,' and 'the boss is hard' concepts from Dark Souls. But what sets it apart is it's top-down play, and one-hit, two-way system. Meaning: the boss has a weakness, you gotta find it (hint: it's pink), and hit the boss before the boss hits you. Two-way, one-hit: one-hit, two-way system. One-hit, two-way: two one-way-hits, and one-way to hit system.

What also sets it apart from the official Dark Souls video game by Square Enix is that it isn't set in Brazil, but also that it borrows from Shadow of Colossus by having no enemies, and being completely empty. In being the first Shadow of the Dark Souls-like, it falls short of capturing the mood of Shadow of the Colossus, but keeps the functionality of the emptiness (which is expediency, btw, if you didn't know). No need to fight little goblin children when you can fight the large goblin parents.

In conclusion, get this if you're feeling top-down, one-shot Dark Souls, but with Shadow of the Colossus level emptiness. This game came out in 2015, though, so literally one person will see this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058771515', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2929, 'last_played': 1706385716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198807781885', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1662024112}
review:
There are good ideas , bosses are varied and creative (which is good considering its a boss rush) but all fights are conceptually similar: hit the target once and honestly going from bosses to bosses is just "the target is more annoying to hit" or "hit it once then hit it again",it also feels very arbitrary sometimes .I've not played it a lot of it to be fair but i can see with the number of bosses recycling this gimmick in an increasing annoying way and it being the bulk of the game, it gets frustrating.I would recommend other games like those by FromSoftware if you're looking for something challenging because in my opinion :-

*Titan Souls is not worth unless you don't have anything better to do*

author: {'steamid': '76561199175773548', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1694226644}
review:
Es un gran juego al estilo de los jefes Souls, tiene una gran dificultad pero no es imposible si logras aprenderte sus patrones, su jugabilidad es muy sencilla (solo 2 botones), y su mÃºsica y arte pixel art es precioso <3 

Si tuviera que ponerle un punto negativo es que hay varios logros que para poder obtenerlos debes pasarte el juego varias veces pero con dificultades cada vez mÃ¡s altas, y en realidad despuÃ©s de un par de veces que te lo pasas no es muy rejugable ni te motiva a hacerlo. 

Pero quitando eso, un muy buen juego para pasar el rato y poner a prueba tus habilidades. 8/10

review: Titan Souls Ã© um jogo que entrega exatamente o que promete de maneira sensacional em vÃ¡rios aspectos. Primeiramente, o acabamento artÃ­stico do jogo Ã© muito bem trabalhado, um dos melhores e mais limpos trabalhos em pixel art que jÃ¡ tive o prazer de jogar, alÃ©m disso, a trilha melÃ³dica se encaixa perfeitamente no contexto grandioso que o jogo pretende passar, e sim, ele consegue passar. Quanto Ã  jogabilidade, pelo que consegui observar do meu tempo de jogo atual, as mecÃ¢nicas sÃ£o extremamente simples: seu personagem possui apenas duas mecÃ¢nicas bÃ¡sicas; no entanto, a simplicidade do protagonista diante da grandiosidade do cenÃ¡rio e complexidade dos inimigos durante todo o jogo enriquecem ainda mais o valor da conquista e sensaÃ§Ã£o de desafio. No fim, sÃ³ sinto falta de um background um pouco mais aprofundado, a histÃ³ria Ã© rasa e, por mais que o objetivo do jogo nÃ£o tenha um foco narrativo por si sÃ³, essa superficialidade me passa a sensaÃ§Ã£o de um jogo casual e menos completo do que potencialmente seria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269399371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1673725802}
review:
I really didn't think this was going to be one of those masochistic games, but it is LOL. It's a bit challenging but not too bad if you get the hang of the controls and have played challenging games before (i.e. Cuphead, Celeste, Jump King, etc.). Unfortunately, this is only meant strictly for the gamepad. If it had the function to use M&K with better controls, I would preferred to play it that way as it's a bit tough to aim with a gamepad. 

I'll still recommend the game as I find the gameplay unique yet very simple if you're into rage-inducing games, but this game isn't for everyone especially if you're looking for something "easy" to play.

I wish it was easier to navigate to the boss because each death spawns you on your last save and it takes quite some time to "walk" up stairs.

review: no rebinds for keyboard, no options to aim bow with a mouse so you're stuck with only shooting in +Ã— and bosses only have 1-2 attacks and get instakilled at cost of constant spam attacks so you gotta just keep attack+roll+attack+roll and repeat that untill you finally hit their weak spot, expect that you also need to retrieve your arrow back everytime but good thing you can just pull it magically, right? well good job standing around like a moron pulling your constantly on wall stucking because you gotta keep moving, for some reason you play as magically immobile mentally ill character which decides to bring only 1 arrow in a fight, so you can't walk and magnetize your magic arrow at same time, gotta stand in and focus for magic arrow while some gigantic fucker tries to smash you in pancakes. Also what fucking retard decided you should respawn and manually walk to the boss entrance again? especially when there nothing to explain where is the weak spot to hit the boss? this game fucking focuses on bosses so why the fuck so much bosses don't have explanation on what to hit and where, also place checkpoints right NEXT to boss you fucker

author: {'steamid': '76561197999549332', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1660085632}
review:
Steam requires you to play a game for more than 3 minutes to review it???

Probably one of the worst most shallow not-games I've ever played.
If you've played any similar game published under Devolver Digital, you've played this.
I would almost bet this was made by an AI, and if not that, a team(?) of people that have never played a video game in their life, except maybe been in the vicinity of someone playing legend of zelda once.

Has no soul, sloggish controls, intentionally bad game design guised as "difficulty". 

TLDR; "ooh zelda is my favorite game!" Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424277277', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1656688793}
review:
Es un juego que me ha sorprendido gratamente. La sensaciÃ³n que te da serÃ­a una mezcla entre: Undertale + Shadow Of The Colossus + juego souls.

Es un juego corto, en torno a las 6h de duraciÃ³n y los logros son muy tentadores por lo que no se hace muy pesado el hecho de rejugarlo.

La dificultad del juego no es apta para todo el mundo pero tras varios intentos creo que cualquiera puede completarlo.

Totalmente recomendado para probar algo original y si tienes poquito tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199125152436', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1659755731}
review: Between our world and the world beyond lie the Titan Souls, the spiritual source of all living things. Scattered amongst the ruins and guarded by the idle titans charged with their care, a solitary hero armed with a single arrow is assembling shards of the Titan Soul in a quest for truth and power.
