author: {'steamid': '76561198119688777', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1659307481}
review:
[h1]At-A-Glance:[/h1]
[b]Game type:[/b] Action
[b]Genre(s):[/b] Boss Rush
[b]Art:[/b] Pixel (e.g. 16-bit)
[b]Length:[/b] 3-5 hours
[b]Pace:[/b] Fast-paced + Slow-paced
[b]Tags:[/b] Fantasy, soulslike, difficult
[b]Computer requirements:[/b] Low end


[h1]Notes:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] This game feels like the primary focus was on the art design. Immaculate pixel art that creates this gorgeous, wonderfully-defined world with exceptional music. To the extent that the gameplay is so relatively shallow that it feels comparatively like an afterthought.
[*] Beating most of the titans felt more like luck than skill. I would know what to do each time, and the time they died just so happened to be when the luck of the shot lined up rather than anything about my abilities or strategy changing. This made for an immensely frustrating gameplay experience - although it certainly felt good to beat a titan, it was because of relief rather than mastery.
[*] Obviously you can be skilled with this - after all, there are speed runs - but the vast majority of the game didn't feel that way. So much of it is having maybe 3-4 seconds of a "battle" before you either die or beat the boss. Combine this with long runbacks and a weird artistic choice on what feels like a long load into each cavern or boss arena... and this 3-5 hour games feels more like 20 minutes of actual playtime and 3.5 hours of walking around in an empty world. Again - the world is beautiful, but at the expense of play.
[*] This game has a weird, schizoid sense of humor that utterly contrasts with the seriousness of the rest of the experience. Did you really name your boss "Brainfreeze" and have a boss with an exposed butt?
[*] So many bosses don't actually die in one hit, as is the game gimmick. If you ran out of one-hit ideas that fast, maybe you should bake them a bit longer?
[*] The final boss was when I decided this game went from frustrating to poorly designed. Many of the boss fights have small windows for attacking, but sometimes there is so much going on the screen that such a small window combined with the charge up for your attack [i]and[/i] several damage pathways ended up feeling like the game was testing happenstance than my actual skill. The final boss is the worst at this, with the hit window being so small that it just ends up being "did it run in front of you this time?" instead of "did you hit the boss?". Yeah, I hit the boss - several times in fact, and even impressively well sometimes. But it didn't run in front of me during its half-second of vulnerability, ergo no dice. Nah, I beat the game and the rest of the titans, I'm fine with this.
[*] No mouse/keyboard support? Well, yeah, keyboard exists - but not in a way that matters. Yeah, that's just lazy implementation, no way around it. Sure a gamepad is "strongly recommended", but that's not really an excuse for a game that's still trying to be sold for $15 USD and is years after release.
[*] In summary - a game I so badly [i]wanted[/i] to like, but was utterly disappointing when the shallowness of the concept betrayed itself. Frustrating and luck-based. It doesn't surprise me that many speed run strategies are "I happened across this" rather than a truly deep understanding of the game. And those that [i]do[/i] reward that deepness of understanding (e.g. Rol-Gayin, Eyecube) are so few and far between that [i]Titan Souls[/i] simply doesn't seem like the kind of game whose strategy was considered long enough during its creative process.
[*]But hey, it is pretty.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198225875168', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1669778654}
review: Let me make something clear that the trailer doesn't: You die after one hit in this game. Afterwards, you will be spawned at a teleporter pad, and have to walk back to the door of whatever boss you were fighting. There are no enemies to fight, nothing interesting to do, just a walk of shame back to the boss door with almost no way to speed it up. This isn't challenge, it's tedium, and it caused me far more frustration than any of the early-game bosses I beat. Half of your game time will be walking back to boss doors. Not worth my time at all.

review:
Ã‰ um bom e criativo jogo bem desafiante que vai te fazer corroer de Ã³dio em diversos momentos, apesar de pessoalmente nÃ£o ter achado seu gameplay tÃ£o recompensador (no sentido emocional) o saldo final foi positivo pela variedade de chefÃµes que o jogo proporciona e por entregar uma experiÃªncia tÃ£o difÃ­cil quanto a premissa sugere. 

Falando mais sobre minha crÃ­tica inicial, o que sinto normalmente ao jogar um jogo difÃ­cil assim Ã© um grande sentimento de satisfaÃ§Ã£o ao derrotar inimigos difÃ­ceis que morri vÃ¡rias vezes tentando passar. PorÃ©m, neste jogo, como na maior parte das vezes vocÃª sÃ³ precisa de um golpe para liquidÃ¡-los eu me sentia mais um burro por nÃ£o ter achado a brecha antes do que realmente feliz apÃ³s derrotÃ¡-los!

De qualquer forma, acredito que isso seja uma coisa bem mais pessoal minha e nÃ£o se refletirÃ¡ em todos que embarcarem nessa experiÃªncia, por isso reitero que recomendo o jogo que, alÃ©m das boas mecÃ¢nicas, tambÃ©m entrega excelente trilha sonora e um bonito visual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162865832', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1657930937}
review:
Normally a game like this would be right up my alley: Beautiful pixel graphics, difficult and creative boss fights, a great soundtrack.  However, there are some serious flaws to this game that left me feeling more annoyed than satisfied by the end of it:

1. The keyboard experience is terrible:  Yes, in the opening of the game, they "strongly recommend" using a controller instead, but that should not be an excuse for such a chasm of disparity between control types.  Keys cannot be remapped and the keyboard can only aim in 8 directions, making many bosses dramatically more difficult or luck-reliant than when you play with the gamepad.  They really should have made the PC controls mouse + keyboard instead.
2. Respawn times: One of the main mechanics of the game is that you have 1 hp, and the boss has 1 hp.  Kind of cool.  However, needing to spend 10 second trekking back to the boss each death (which in all likelihood happened less than 10 seconds into the fight) gets grating very quickly.  This isn't something that they should have copied from the Dark Souls games, instead they should have learned from Super Meat Boy or Hotline Miami: When you can die at the snap of a finger, getting back into the action at a snap of a finger keeps annoyance to a minimum.
3. Empty world: The map is beautiful and vast, but there is almost nothing in it.  Sure, you have to do some general exploration to find the boss hubs/respawn points, but other than that there is only like one not that hidden secret to find.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976859923', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1657482964}
review: I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561199073263345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1657786870}
review:
most people will say it is amazing but this is a bad game.
i am so tired of game devs today just pouring resources on appearance and music but not making sure the game is actually enjoyable or plays well.
this is one of those exact indie games.
rather than make skill based challenges, or a learning curve, nearly every boss here after the first few simply has 5-6 things going on the screen that you have to track at the same time. thats not challenge. thats making a mess. you can beat bosses first try or after 20, its 90% luck based.

i've played dozens of 'good production values' indies. i am not impressed by that anymore.
too formulaic, just copies themes and ideas from other 'artistic' games and nothing else.

i got this game for free but i would not take money to play it in retrospect.

[h2]Short Game Description[/h2]
Titan Souls is a souls-like game that is pretty original, where you don't have any HP and you have to kill them without taking any hit with their different boss mechanics or you will be dead.
[list]
[*][h3]Positives[/h3]
Talking about the positive aspects, the graphic's pixel style are pretty beautiful and fits perfectly to the game, with their thematic scenarios and bosses. Also, the game difficulty is pretty balanced and at the same time challenging without being repetitive on any of the bosses.

[*][h3]Negatives[/h3]
Besides all the positives, what I personally didn't like is that the story is not really well explained.

[/list][h2][u]Conclusion[/u][/h2]
The game is a good experience and a way to enjoy an afternoon, which you can buy in sales for a really low price. The game is a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121971540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1656732106}
review: There's a lot of good things about this game, but I also find way too much unrefined camera control and button control.  Way too often find the game doesn't properly respond to rolling, which makes some fights terrible to deal with when the player can't seem to get out of the way of attacks properly.  I also find the incessant tendency for the camera to pull enemy position or player position so far off screen that you can't hope to figure out what's going on--yet the enemy can still blast you from off screen quicker than you can react.  The game is hard, but it's hard due to game design outside the player's control.  I want to like the environment.  I want to like the boss fights.  I want to like the simplicity of it all.  But it's hard to keep playing when I don't feel in control of the most basic of movements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121381002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1656701932}
review: This game is brutal, as in extremely punishing (you die after one hit), but is not as difficult as some make it out to be. The last few bosses are definitely VERY hard, but most other bosses were very beatable in 10-30 deaths. Maybe for some people 10-30 deaths is their standard of difficulty, but because my first game with real combat was hollow knight, my standard of difficulty is at least 40-60 deaths

author: {'steamid': '76561198356122995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 146, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1711935331}
review:
Amazing game I have beaten it 5 times as of posting this and plan to beat it much more. these game has dark souls type vibes as the boss fights are unforgiving and you will definetly die MANY times on each of them. all of the bosses have a unique way of fighting and a unique way of killing them really fun play highly recommend
Edit: I now have over 100 hours of play time and have been able to shave my 100% time down to 22:22 in game time. I have never had so much fun speed running a game, truly a gem.

review:
It's just boss fights, empty areas and your only attack is an arrow which you either go pick up or have it slowly come back to you- while you're frozen in place. That's it. That's the whole game.

Plus when you switch to another resolution the game screen gets off center so you have to go into the titan.exe and override the dpi. Can't turn off screen shake, and the camera zooms in and out constantly when shooting and retrieving your single arrow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066819249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1656328404}
review:
Every game has a "quit moment". A moment where the frustration / boredom of playing the game outweighs the investment one has in continuing to play the game.

Titan Soul made the poor design choice to make the player respawn at a set checkpoint and have him walk back to the boss arena. Every single time they die. In a game where everything, including the bosses, die in one hit, dying in this way presents itself as a fat and juicy "quit moment". Why would I want to put myself through the trial and error of beating each boss when the amount of time spent just walking back rivals the time I'm spending actually fighting the bosses? 

It's sheer bad design and a deal breaker for many, me included. It's a shame because the core concept is elegant and interesting.

If you want to play this game, I recommend you try a demo first if possible or watch a lets play first. This game goes for dirt cheap whenever it's on sale, so I also recommend to wait for one of those sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064616944', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1656097659}
review:
The art style and music are good. The controls are a bit meh. It is unfortunate that we can't remap them, but you learn after a while.

Most bosses are certainly well designed, others not so much. One thing I have to say that I noticed is that when fighting 'The Soul', you have to be fairly close when you shoot an arrow towards it to start the fight. If you are too far away, it'll do nothing.

Overall, there's not much to say here. It's a fairly difficult game that looks and sounds good, with a potentially mysterious and/or confusing story, if any. You'll enjoy it if you like difficult, souls-like games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061807327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1652802129}
review:
Titan Souls is simply special.

Itâ€™s a short and sweet experience, focused on doing what it does very well. There is a main combat mechanic (bow and arrow, and you recall your arrow after youâ€™ve shot it), and you fight big bosses - titans. 

Boss fights are difficult, but also a good kind of difficult. They are not grindy, you are not whittling down at a large health bar. In fact, bosses die in one or two hits. In order to land that hit, however, you truly have to understand how the boss works, figure out when they reveal their weak spot, and when and how you get the opportunity to shoot (the single arrow and recall mechanic also comes into play here). You as the player die in one hit as well, and yes, you will die a lot. But you get to try again and build up an understanding of how the boss works, how to dodge it better, and, ultimately, how to hit that weak spot and secure the kill. Each win against a boss is extremely satisfying.

Great attention is paid to detail. For example, how the dodge roll interacts with stairs. You canâ€™t roll up stairs, but if you roll down the stairs you will tumble until reaching the bottom. Little details like that add so much and make the game brilliantly designed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399252018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1655594506}
review:
Me gusto el jueguito, la banda sonora es espectacular, pero se puede decir que en algunos jefes puede llegar a ser frustante, ya que de las 450 muertes que tuve 300 fueron de dos jefes.
La rejugabilidad es buena, puesto que al finalizar el primer jefe final se te desbloquean dos nuevas opciones que permiten rejugarlo de buena manera.
Mi calificacion de este juego es de 7 de 10 platanitos.

Juego 7/10
MÃºsica 10/10
Jugabilidad 6/10 (Puesto que solo se ocupan 2 botones.)

author: {'steamid': '76561199129396788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1662227837}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980472955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1655490074}
review:
Coming at this after Death's Door, the developers' follow-up, it's clear to see the foundations of it laid here. In comparison Titan Souls feels like a very confident proof of concept. The challenge, to take on numerous bosses when both they and you have only 1hp, is fresh and most of the bosses are enjoyably challenging, albeit those that are more interesting to work out are balanced out by the more frustrating ones. Open windows for attack time, certain hit-boxes etc. can be frustratingly short when you've already worked out how to defeat a boss, to add to a variety of other issues that do drag things down a little.

At the same time it is a short game and you'll be able to near-instantly recognise if it's for you or not. Though I think Death's Door is superior in every way (including some remixed enemies from Titan Souls) there's enough here to enjoy despite the flaws, especially if you're encouraged to carry on with the challenge runs. Personally, the first run was satisfying enough, but I'm still left feeling like I'd rather replay Death's Door than search out every crumb here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278956126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1619639944}
review: I am floored that this game is as well liked as it is. There's a good game here, but every time you die you have to walk a long ass way back to fight the boss that just killed you. It is infuriating, because it absolutely kills the pacing of the game. It's just a chore that has to happen between playing the actual game EVERY SINGLE TIME YOU DIE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198944047318', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1681093526}
review: The game is quite hard considering it is a souls-like, I breezed through the first 4 bosses dying only a few times to 3 of them but the next bosses are sure to give me trouble. Now the game itself seems decent enough but I wish there was more, finding out the weak points of the bosses and executing your plan to defeat them is a fun exercise to do, but after defeating it and getting your 10 seconds of adrenaline, you basically get nothing in return unlike other games which is quite boring to do repetitively.

review: One hit and you die. However, its not that punishing. You save before each boss and keep rinse and repeating until you find out how to hit their "heart" once for the deathblow. Definitely worth a buy if $7 or less. A few of the boss music scores are really awesome too.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058467185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1692658599}
review: Titan Souls is a boss rush that is very simplistic, but brutally difficult. In it, you are tasked with defeating all of the 21 bosses in the game. There are no enemies, just 21 bosses. You have three tools in your arsenal: a bow with one arrow, a dodge roll, and the ability to force pull your arrow back to your character. Most bosses can be killed in one to three hits depending on their gimmick. It all comes down to finding it. Depending on your skill, you could beat this game in an afternoon, or in a few weeks. I recommend this game because of the feeling of accomplishment that you get after beating every boss. Overall it is fun, but it's a hard game. I wouldn't get it at full price, but it goes on sale often. Also, once you beat the game, you should look at speedrun strategies for all of the bosses. The bosses you struggled on for hours are done in half a second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084642319', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1654224674}
review: I don't get the appeal of this game, all the bosses are just gimmick fights that require timing (and some rng for some of the fights). Literally every bosses is beatable within secs of entering the boss room and most you can just cheese and win instantly with little effort. The game is designed terribly the only hard fights are the fights that require some rng and precise aiming but the game forces you to use a controller so not exactly the best controls for a game that requires precise aiming. There were only 2 bosses in this game that were actually a bit hard and thats only because they require you  to hit a moving target within 1-2 secs while also not dying to arrow or balls of energy, even the final secret boss "truth" which has 3 phases is incrediblely easy. I think this game is way overpriced for 3 hours of content, I wouldn't even buy it on sale you could get cheaper games that are better instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963430674', 'num_games_owned': 2474, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1654126292}
review:
Tl;dr Donâ€™t waste your time nor money on this game. Doesnâ€™t matter if youâ€™re an achievement hunter or just someone who wants to play parts of the game and maybe even finish it.

Having gotten all achievements, I can safely say that I cannot recommend this game to anyone, especially to achievement hunters. To get all achievements, you must defeat 12 or all 19 bosses in a run under certain conditions like â€œdefeat the final boss within 20 minutes,â€ â€œdefeat the final boss with rolling disabled,â€ or â€œkill all bosses without dying onceâ€ which are all extremely tedious and unenjoyable to achieve. Itâ€™s unlikely that youâ€™ll even feel satisfied once you do get all achievements; instead of feeling accomplished, youâ€™ll only feel glad that you can finally forget about this game once and for all. Due to these reasons, achievement hunters should avoid this game unless you understand the possibility that youâ€™ll never obtain all achievements (legititmately).

â€œOkay, what about more casual gamers who just want to take the most fun out of the game before abandoning it regardless of if they discovered all of the content or even defeated the final boss?â€ Well that does improve the chances that a player will enjoy Titan Souls, however little their experience may be. Does that mean Iâ€™ll recommend this game to casuals? No, not really. Hereâ€™s a list of some of the reasons why I wonâ€™t recommend new players to pick up this game:
[list]
[*] The controls are not that great and feel sluggish.
[*] The bosses may soon become unfulfilling to defeat, beginning to feel more like an unwanted task than anything else.
[*] When you die to a boss, youâ€™ll be sent back to a checkpoint. The checkpoints are almost always some distance away from the boss door, which just artificially adds to the time you take to defeat the boss as they can kill you within 10 second sometimes.
[*] To add to the artificial time grievance, when you die to a boss, the death screen takes a little too long before letting you respawn. This feels even worse after some deaths.
[*] While some bosses feel fair and are admittedly fun to fight, other bosses are a pain to fight and are very unfulfilling.
[*] Youâ€™re probably going to need a gaming controller to actually enjoy this game. While some bosses may be made easier when you only have 8 ways to aim your arrow, this is not true for most of them.
[/list]
These reasons, with many more I didnâ€™t remember to add or simply chose not to, are why I find it hard to recommend Titan Souls to casual players, or anybody else for that matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1653728786}
review:
- Very simple controls
- Boss rush where every boss is almost like a puzzle
- All bosses have a unique gimmick
- Both you and the bosses die in one hit
- Cool music for each boss

- Boss music almost never lasts very long with how fast they can die
- Dying punishes you by making you run back to the boss room each time from a further checkpoint

- Pointlessly empty world
- The difficulty of each boss are either obnoxiously hard or ridiculously easy, but mostly the former
- The 2D top-down view makes this kind of game often really annoying to play with sometimes not being able to tell whether or not you're about to touch a wall or hazard
- Poorly optimized game with random crashes in some areas
- Despite Steam saying it's constantly running at 60FPS, you can visibly see that the game's frame rate is dipping in some areas

I found an entrance to a lava boss and the game kept crashing every time I entered it. Couldn't be bothered to keep playing from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044605611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1653494131}
review:
This game had a lot of potential but falls flat in some areas.

Really cool concept of "You have 1 HP, but so does everything else". You're going to die to boss fights. A lot. That's not the problem. The problem is that you have to constantly run back to the boss arena. Over and over and over and... Some locations are right outside the respawn area. Some take a minute of walking to get back there. There's no in-game purpose. There aren't trash mobs to bypass. There aren't any environmental hazards or traps to slip past. It's just a tedious march back to the boss that serves no purpose other than to add artificial lengthening of the game.

Having no 'overworld trash' was neat. Only boss fights? Combined with the 1 HP design, this sounds really neat. However boss design for some fights are not very good. You have some good bosses like Sludgeheart, Gol-lath, Vinethesis, Obello, and Knight Elhanan. These fights have their gimmicks, but don't feel unfair to fight. Dying to them usually feels fair. These fights feel like they're winnable once you get the hang of it. Then you have bosses like Mol-Qayin, Onyxia, and the Yeti. These boss gimmicks are annoying and unfun to play against. Dying to them feels annoying and bad because the gimmicks are not so great.

Finally the Keyboard vs Controller controls. Yes it's highly recommended to use a Controller, but not everyone has one on hand. The janky aiming of the arrow keys with Keyboard make aiming extremely frustrating, especially when certain bosses have a very small window of opportunity to hit their weak spots and playing on Keyboard means you only can shoot in 8 directions (Cardinals and Inter-cardinals via the Arrow Key combinations). Controller players have free aim with the sticks. 

Overall, I had fun, but the issues above killed my motivation to continue playing the other modes or go for other achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978329127', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1653428463}
review:
Positiv:
- Nette Pixel Grafik
- SchÃ¶ne Musik
- Kurz (das ist eine gute Sache, aufgrund der Negativ Punkte)

Negativ:
- Steuerung ist nicht optimal (siehe Fazit)
- Bosse sind oft nicht gut gestaltet (siehe Fazit)
- Zu lange Laufwege 
- Welt ist leer und uninteressant
- Frustfaktor ist extrem hoch
- Story ist nicht vorhanden (siehe Fazit)

Fazit:
Titan Souls macht fÃ¼r solch ein simples Spielkonzept eine Menge Fehler. Das Spiel weist nur vier KnÃ¶pfe zu. Beide Sticks, von denen der Stick zum Umschauen nicht benÃ¶tigt wird um das Spiel zu schaffen. Und zwei KnÃ¶pfe. Ausweichen und SchieÃŸen. Nun sind auf einem modernen Controller noch mindestens 6 KnÃ¶pfe Ã¼brig die nicht genutzt werden. Man kann nur Sprinten, nachdem man einen Dodge gemacht hat. Man kann den gespannten Bogen nur durch eine Ausweichrolle entspannen (was nicht immer gelingt). 
Rollt man gegen ein Hindernis, wird man einen Augenblick lang betÃ¤ubt. Sehr frustrierend und fÃ¼hrt zu einigen vermeidbaren Toden. Bei einem solchen Spieldesign auch nicht nachvollziehbar, weshalb so etwas rein muss. FÃ¼r die Glaubhaftigkeit der Welt, tut dieses "Feature" nichts.
Die Bosse rangieren zwischen viel zu einfach, Ã¼ber knackig und gut gestaltet, bis frustrierend, weil vollkommen beliebig. Gerade der (vor-)letzte Boss hat mich Ã¼ber 70 Versuche gekostet. Aber den Sieg brachte mir dann ein GlÃ¼ckstreffer, den ich quasi blind abfeuern musste, weil das Trefferfenster nur eine Sekunde oder so betrug.
Die Story ist quasi nicht vorhanden. Kryptische Symboliken, die beliebig gedeutet werden kÃ¶nnen, sind keine Story.  Das ist schlicht und einfach schlechter Schreibstil.
Spielt lieber den Nachfolger "Death's Door". Das ist ein amÃ¼santes und unterhaltsames Spiel und es fasst euch im Wahren Ende nochmal die gesamte "Story" von Titan Souls zusammen (was nicht viel ist).

author: {'steamid': '76561198058470373', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1653494688}
review:
Good concept and really nice pixel art, but awful execution. This game could adequately be described as a walking simulator with the occasional boss fight. 

It's not really hard because it's hard. It's hard because it's poorly designed. The controls are legitimately awful, which makes the game hard in its own right (sluggish). You've also got bosses that are only hard by virtue of annoying gimmicks rather than being a one-shot puzzle, and on top of that, the difficulty bounces between pathetically easy to just annoying. 

Lava Blob, Water Serpent, Yeti. Are these bosses hard because they're well designed puzzles? No, they're hard because they're annoying gimmicks. 

It's like if someone made a pale imitation of Shadow of the Colossus, but without the fun. It's artificially hard, sluggish, and just anti-fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077716479', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1653303058}
review:
The idea is good. You have only 1 arrow and 1HP. Same as bosses, they all have 1HP.
But the problem is you dont know how to kill those bosses, all you need to do is figuring out. 
That's where the game gets boring. You just go the area, try something and die. Start over again. For 20 sec bossfight you waste so much time.
Map is little bit confusing and not that pleasant.

review:
El Dark Souls me gusta, me he pasado los 3. Sin embargo este juego no me ha gustado.
Demasiado morir para tan poca recompensa al final.

Si quieres jugar y acabar cabreado, este es tu juego.

Â¿Porque "Paco Mecanico" te manda besitos y quiere repetir a tu wassap?

author: {'steamid': '76561198365822116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1652798993}
review:
Its simple right? One shot to the weakspot of the Titan and he goes down 
Wrong! Even tho you need just one shot to defeat the Titan, its really hard especially in iron mode
Overall i enjoyed this game, tho i have to admit i had to look some tutorials up before i was able to defeat some of the Titans
The music is great, graphical design is beutiful and each Titan is unique
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067134615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1651963727}
review:
C'est un jeu qui avait un bon potentiel pour les fans de try hard ou de challenge.
La musique est satisfaisante mÃªme si pas si marquante que Ã§a au final, les graphismes minimalistes font le taff.
Mais voila il y a un gros manque de level design et d'exploration dans une grande carte vide pour rien.
De plus l'accumulation : 
- des points de rÃ©apparition qui sont Ã  15/30 secondes de marches avant de pouvoir re rentrer dans une salle de boss
- l'ia des boss qui te aimbot voir te prÃ©shot 
- devoir tirer en 0.2 seconde en ayant une visÃ©e parfaite sans faire une seule erreur sinon mort quasi assurÃ©
- les fights qui durent moins de 30 secondes pour du try hard de 10 minutes
- une difficultÃ© alÃ©atoire
- des boss (surtout le dernier) dÃ©bilement difficile car des patterne fouilli +  certains defauts citÃ©s ci dessus (et qui trichent sur certaines mÃ©caniques apprises) 

est gÃªnante pour un jeu qui se qualifie boss rush/die and retry.

Pourtant la base mÃªme du gameplay, je parle du coup unique Ã  l'arc bien placÃ© et de la roulade roulade comme seules actions possibles, Ã©tait vraiment plaisant.

En rÃ©sumÃ© mÃªme reÃ§u gratuitement l'expÃ©rience est gÃ¢chÃ© pour tout ces dÃ©fauts.
J'ajouterais que le jeu est un peu court. Mais je pense que c'est parce que je n'ai pas lancÃ© les modes de difficultÃ©s supÃ©rieur. Ceux ci me semblent vraiment infaisable pour un simple moldu comme moi.

review:
I think about playing this game again from time-to-time.  Cute, moderately challenging, fun world to explore.  Even has a few fun little secrets to find.  Whenever this game is on sale, for $1.50, it is an absolute steal!

I probably wouldn't ever recommend buying this full price, but it is for sure a game that you throw on the ol' wishlist and buy it the second it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976890551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1651844497}
review: Not really my cup of tea, mostly just got it because it was on sale for like a $1.50. I think the reason I didn't really enjoy the game that much was because of a combination of a bunch of little things that, on their own isn't all that bad, but multiply together to make the experience more annoying than enjoyable. So, on the standard difficulty, most bosses take one hit to kill, BUT, you have to find/expose it's weak point, and a lot of the bosses are closer to puzzles, while some you are just waiting for a specific attack, this system is super cool and works amazingly for a boss rush game, however, it's not always made clear what exactly you are supposed to be doing to defeat the boss, and they all attack extremely fast, not too mention you die in one hit, all of that is fine an dandy, there isn't anything wrong with experimenting a bit to figure something out, but here is the straw that broke the camels back, the windows to hit the weak spots are often INSANELY short, and is usually paired with an attack you have to avoid while also having enough time to charge your bow to be able to even shoot it at all, you can get off a quick shot but you have to be almost touching the weak point, and even then you have to hold down the button for a tiny bit as if you just tap the shoot button you won't actually fire. All of this together leads to dying several times to a boss, trying to shoot what you think is the weak point, but starting to doubt if it even is because it seems all but impossible to hit, i looked up a guide quite a few times just to make sure i was doing things correctly, and indeed i was, you just need extremely precise positioning. I enjoy difficult games, but there is a point where games stop feeling like they are actually hard, and just feel like you have to press the buttons in one specific order and timing and if you do anything else you lose, like one of that platformers that constantly have bullets filling the entire screen except for one specific gap where your character has to be at all times. Two other things i personally didn't like, one is too much walking, i like exploration, but this world is far too empty and the art is far too basic, I constantly found myself just wishing i was at the next boss already, and my final complaint is that on the vine boss, in order to expose it's weakness you have to pull one of it's petals down, but when you do this, for god knows what reason, the petal literally just hides your character, it's baffling that no one saw this as an issue when they released the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199089813727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1651642759}
review:
DifÃ­cil no significa bueno.
Me gustan los juegos desafiantes, soy muy fanÃ¡tico de la saga Souls pero este juego es frustrante e injusto.
Las peleas exigen perfecciÃ³n y te castiga solo por empezar una pelea, nunca o casi nunca vas a ganar una pelea a la primera.
Supongo que estÃ¡ bien si te gustan los "boss rush" pero no cambia el hecho de que el juego no te de oportunidad ni tiempo de aprender. Al morir, se empieza en el ultimo punto de guardado que normalmente se encuentra cerca del jefe pero suma a la frustraciÃ³n que ademÃ¡s de morir por un golpe, haya que caminar nuevamente hacia la habitaciÃ³n del jefe.
La etiqueta "tipo dark souls" estÃ¡ totalmente fuera de lugar. Lo comprÃ© por eso cuando estaba en oferta y lo olvidÃ©. No me molestarÃ­a si fuera un "tipo dark souls" malo pero no se parece en lo absoluto a un souls, ni siquiera estÃ¡ cerca de ser un metroidvania al menos.
Me parece que es publicidad engaÃ±osa, no es "tipo dark souls" por tener souls en el tÃ­tulo y ademÃ¡s deberÃ­a tener la etiqueta de puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198971411517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1643493456}
review: Titan Souls is a simple game, Shoot the bosses in their weakspots once and you win. The game is incredibly difficult though, as you also die in only one hit. Pretty much the only thing to do in the game is fight bosses, its a boss rush. Although it may seem daunting at first, every boss is balanced with the knowledge of how weak your character is, no fights ever felt unfair. In a way, the bosses themselves are puzzles that force you to find their weakness and how to exploit it. The combat is balanced and the bosses are fun, and therefore this simple game is good because it has mastered the two things it set out to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061211710', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1683064433}
review:
[h1]~ Hintergrund ~[/h1]

Das Spiel besteht aus insgesamt 18 BosskÃ¤mpfen[spoiler]und einem geheimen Endboss, sobald man alle 18 Titanen besiegt und die Seele aufgesammelt hat[/spoiler]. Als Waffe gegen diese Bosse hat man nur einen Bogen, mit nur einem Pfeil, welchen man nach dem SchieÃŸen immer wieder zurÃ¼ckholen muss. Jeder Boss hat einen Schwachpunkt, den man zuerst ermitteln muss, um diesen zu tÃ¶ten. Sobald man diesen aber gefunden hat, ist der Rest nicht mehr so schwer.

[h1]~ Schwierigkeit ~[/h1]

Das Spiel ist wirklich sehr schwer, da man hier nur ein Pfeil hat, den man auch immer wieder zurÃ¼ckholen muss.
Zudem stirbt man hier jedes Mal nach einem Schlag

[h1]~ Grafik ~[/h1]

Sehr schÃ¶nes Pixelart Game.

[h1]~ Musik ~[/h1]

Die Musik ist sehr gut und atmosphÃ¤risch.

[h1]~ Story ~[/h1]

Wirklich eine Story habe ich hier nicht gesehen oder verfolgt. Es geht einfach nur darum, die ganzen Titanen zu tÃ¶ten. Die Story, wenn Ã¼berhaupt vorhanden, steht hier eher im Hintergrund.

[h1]~ Preis ~[/h1]

Aufgrund der geringen Spielzeit (90 Minuten fÃ¼r mich) halte ich den Preis von 14,99â‚¬ nicht fÃ¼r gerechtfertigt. Man kann dieses Spiel zwar mehrere Male spielen, aber das tut kaum ein Spieler. Daher wÃ¼rde ich auf ein Angebot warten.

[h1]~ Anforderungen ~[/h1]

Es ist ein Pixel-Spiel. Selbst dein Toaster kÃ¶nnte das Spiel zum laufen kriegen.

[h1]~ LÃ¤nge ~[/h1]

FÃ¼r mich hat der erste Spieldurchlauf ca. 90 Minuten gedauert.

[h1]~ SpaÃŸfaktor~[/h1]

Das Spiel macht sehr viel SpaÃŸ und die BosskÃ¤mpfe sind alle sehr kreativ und verschieden gestaltet. Einige sind mal leicht und andere sind teilweise sehr schwer. Das einzige was wirklich ein SpaÃŸkiller war, war das stÃ¤ndige laufen in der leeren Landschaft. Denn nach jedem Tod muss man wieder zurÃ¼ck zum Boss laufen. Denkt daher immer daran einmal Ã¼ber die Checkpoints zu laufen, um dort zu respawnen, damit der Weg nicht so weit ist.

[h1]~ Wiederspielbarkeit ~[/h1]

Man kann dieses Spiel immer wieder neu spielen. Ob fÃ¼r Speedruns oder fÃ¼r Achievements. Aber auch, wenn man einfach mal 1-2 Monate wartet.

[h1]~ Lohnt sich der Kauf? ~[/h1]

FÃ¼r 14,99â‚¬ lohnt es sich nicht. Ich wÃ¼rde auf einen Sale warten, da trotz hohem Wiederspielfaktor, die Spielzeit sehr gering ist.

review:
Peut-Ãªtre que plus de 3h ne sont pas suffisantes pour faire une Ã©valuation objective mais voici la mienne Ã  chaud. Les boss sont variÃ©s et la dynamique pendant les combat est prenante, on sent que l'on doit jouer parfaitement et Ã©tablir une vraie stratÃ©gie pour gagner. La musique des boss est diverse et variÃ©e, Ã§a nous met dans l'ambiance. 
NÃ©anmoins, j'ai rencontrÃ© beaucoup d'aspects qui ont quelques peu gÃ¢chÃ© mon expÃ©rience de jeu. Tout d'abord, je comprend le fait de vouloir crÃ©er une grande carte. Cela appuie sur le sentiment que le joueur est seul dans un vaste monde. Mais d'un point de vue gameplay, c'est ennuyeux vraiment. On met trop de temps Ã  trouver les autres boss qui sont dans les autres bios. 
Par ailleurs, le fait de ne pas spawm directement dans la salle de boss aprÃ¨s une mort ajoute un temps supplÃ©mentaire inutile qui n'apporte rien dans le jeu. On doit mettre plus de temps Ã  revenir dans la salle du boss qu'Ã  combattre rÃ©ellement. Car les boss peuvent Ãªtre vaincus trÃ¨s vites.
Je voulais aussi parler des roulades hors combat. Je suis conscient que c'est pour donner un aspect rÃ©aliste, mais se cogner H24 sur les escaliers est exaspÃ©rant. Encore une fois, c'est une perte de temps supplÃ©mentaire, et dans ce genre de jeu, on ne veut pas non plus passer trop de temps Ã  devoir se dÃ©placer entre les boss. 
Parlons maintenant d'une phase de combat qui m'a bien ennuyÃ©, celle avec l'avant dernier boss qui est un gardien Ã  deux mains. Pourquoi le maintien de l'activation des dalles est-elle alÃ©atoire ? Les mains se posent dessus, puis sans le vouloir nous attaquent. Alors que cela aurait Ã©tÃ© plus logique Ã  mon sens qu'elle restent au sol. 
Et maintenant du cÃ´tÃ© de la flÃ¨che, c'est terrible comme le fait de viser Ã  un endroit nous fait tirer Ã  cÃ´tÃ©. Cela m'est arrivÃ© plusieurs fois d'Ãªtre dans l'axe de tir, sans mauvaise foi, et de tout de mÃªme ratÃ© ! j'ai l'impression que la prÃ©cision laisse Ã  dÃ©sirer. On n'a plus l'impression parfois de gagner par chance que par rÃ©elle prÃ©cision. 
Bref, c'est un classique, mais je ne l'ai pas apprÃ©ciÃ©. Il manque une rÃ©elle entitÃ© au jeu d'un point de vue narratif, et la lenteur de certaines phases de gameplay est trop importante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050669937', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1650062844}
review:
One arrow, one health point, one objetive, KILL ALL THE TITANS.

Titan Souls is an amazing indie game, It shows how you can make a great game using a minimalist approach.

- The game only uses two buttons, you can shoot and row, I don't recommend, but you could play It with a NES controller
- There is no UI
- There is pretty much no dialog or text
- You die in one hit, but the boss also die in one hit (sometimes you have to hit something to expose the weak point of the boss)

I saw some reviews complaining about wasting time respawning and walking to the boss over and over, but I think this is part of the experience, It is a way for you to cooldown and also a way for the game to say that you are the one going after the boss, there is nothing forcing you to fight.

The only reason that I can't recommend this game for everyone is because It is hard as fuck, even though It always feels fair when you die some people just don't like this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198893483535', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1649660295}
review: I want to give this game a rating somewhere in the middle. The pixel art is great and it all looks quite fluid and nice, but there are a couple issues dragging down the overall experience. The idea of you and the boss being able to one shot each other is really nice and I think it delivered on some of that potential at least. Several of them have some unique ideas thrown in and can create some interesting dodge and shoot setups, but some are either pushovers or just flat out confusing. The biggest issue though is the time between spawning and getting another chance to fight. Some of the paths between the checkpoint and the boss take upwards of 15 seconds to traverse, which stacks up incredibly quickly the more you die. I think this game had good ideas but it was much too tedious at times for me to recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261190541', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1649449283}
review:
Just feels incredibly clunky to play. Your arrow comes back way too slowly, and you have to stand completely still to call it back as well. I can understand doing this could provide some strategy, but it's incredibly frustrating trying to kite a boss around for 20 seconds while you slowly pull your arrow back, only for it to collide with the boss. The game just isn't very exciting.

Both you and the boss only taking one hit to kill is a cool idea, but some of the bosses are downright frustrating to play against. Couple this with annoying run backs every single time you die to a single mistake, it's unnecessarily punishing and personally not a fun time. 

A positive I can say is that the pixel art is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021710517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1649429066}
review:
This game isn't for most people.
It is boss rush mixed with questionably pointless and empty map exploration.
You will spend more time running back to a boss than learning the boss.
Requires a console controller which is always a pc port red flag. At the time I purchased this game the need for a controller was not stated on the sale page.
You are made of glue and will not slide or bounce from any contact with the terrain. This is by design as it is meant to punish you and effectively stun your character. Most directions on the stick won't free you either, you'll need to make direction appropriate counter motions for any hope of oh wait you're dead already.
Tons of buttons in this world but you only get two. Roll Forward and Run are bound to the same key for that authentic Soulsian vibe. There can be no iteration or improvement on design as Dark Souls is the perfect game apparently.

10/10 will update when I've beat the thing. But I don't forgive controller mandatory PC ports.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996910141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1648874767}
review:
Having recently finished Death's Door I was motivated to go back and finally finish this game to better understand the connection between the two. To this day I would consider it one of the hardest games I've ever played and I definitely didn't make it any easier on myself by trying to get the achievements tied to each boss for special kills and the like.

When I first picked this game up years ago I got stuck on one of the bosses in the first area I went to (it was the yeti in the snow area). I couldn't get the timing down or figure out the best way to actually beat the boss. Coming back to the game, I saved that area for last and this time I was willing to watch the occasional video to help me figure out how to approach some of the fights I got stuck on. Nailing the execution would still take a few attempts to get right and the last few bosses at the end of the game were challenges that I can feel proud to have overcome.

Similar to Super Meat Boy, this is a game where you will die many times in rapid succession but getting back to where you were to try again is such a quick and painless process that it never gets overly frustrating. You don't have to beat every boss to finish the game so if a fight has you stumped you can move on to somewhere else. Worst case scenario you can put the game down for a bit and come back later. Often a small reset like going to bed and coming back in the morning was enough to get me in a calm enough mindset to get the fight I was stuck on down in only 2 more tries.

The game has a perfect mix of Shadow of the Colossus and Dark Souls vibes and holds up amazingly well as a challenging but completely fair experience that you just need a little determination to get through.

author: {'steamid': '76561199048998153', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1661113781}
review:
Tough as shit but surprisingly short.

Seemingly storyless but surprisingly lore filled.

Seems like a one playthrough game but has a surprisingly large amount of replay value.

Titan Souls is a very suprising game. Highly recommend.

No idea why so many reviews say the checkpoints are too far away, it's about a 10 second trip maximum between bosses and respawn points.

review: Un juego en â€œTop Downâ€ en un estilo de pixel art, en el que el personaje podra moverse, correr, rodar y tendra de arma un arco especial con UNA sola flecha; la cual podra controlar haceindo que regrese, esta flecha regresara a donde este el personaje pero podra chocar de regreso haciendo que se atore con piedras o agarrar velocidad y podra impactar nuevamente y contara como hit, esta misma flecha podra interactuar con el entorno, es decir que si existe una fogata o algo que produzca fuego y la flecha parsa por encima esta se prendera en fuego y realizara un impacto con fuego o la flecha podria activar botones. El juego cuenta con Bosses que mueren de un golpe asi mismo los bosses te matan de un solo golpe, es decir todos los personajes contienen 1 punto de HP, sin embargo existen enemigos que para que revele su â€œpunto dÃ©bilâ€ tendras que dar varios golpes, estos no le realizaran daÃ±o, pero afecftaran el combate.

review:
um jogo de estilo boss rush e souls like extremamente desafiador, serÃ¡ mesmo?

titan souls Ã© um jogo incrivel,(nele se vocÃª tomar um hit vocÃª morre), uns dos meu jogos favoritos, pode parecer dificil mas depois que vocÃª pega o jeito
fica muito bom e satisfatorio, a histÃ³ria do jogo Ã© extremamente desconhecida e contada por fragmentos de diversas
maneiras.
depois de zerar o jogo vocÃª adquire 3 modos o modo hard, o alma de aÃ§o (nÃ£o pode morrer) e o no roll (nÃ£o pode rolar), e se vocÃª matar o verdadeiro
boss final vocÃª adquire um novo modo no qual mostra o nome dos chefes, e isso junto com outras coisas contam
a histÃ³ria do jogo.
o jogo pode parecer dificil mas depois que vocÃª pega o jeito e decora o padrÃ£o dos chefes o jogo fica facil,
mas mesmo assim dificil.

simplismente jogar esse jogo e decorar como matar os bosses Ã© extremamente bom e satisfatorio,
com 54 horas de jogo nÃ£o consegui platinar e ainda tem coisas na histÃ³ria pra descobrir, (a histÃ³ria Ã© religiosa mas ta extremamente escondida).

titan souls Ã© um dos melhores boss rushs que eu ja vi, ou se nÃ£o o melhor, esse jogo Ã© melhor que death doors, e eu ja vi ele ficar na promoÃ§Ã£o por 5 conto, entÃ£o a nota desta obra de arte Ã© 10/10, vale super apena comprar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432455159', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1647050905}
review:
-Look, I beat this game on a keyboard...and that was a mistake, use the controller if you have one because for some f****ing reason the devs don't let you remap the buttons and you can't use the mouse to aim.

-All of the bosses are fun except the last one and the one in the lava level that uses two spiked iron balls, sometimes he spins in the first 5 seconds of battle and other times it takes him more than a minute, and it's hard to know wich direction he is going to face after the attack is over and you have a window of like 2 f***ing seconds to get him. 

-The game has a beatiful art style and soundtrack and the combat is fun, except in the two bosses I mentioned above.

-If you liked Dark Souls and Shadow Of The Colossus you'll probably enjoy this one, just please, use a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069065539', 'num_games_owned': 2223, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1646436793}
review:
[i]Titan Souls[/i] is a 2D Soulslike action game focused on killing bosses. With a minimalist approach taken to the controls and storytelling, the thrill of defeating a variety of one-hit-kill bosses is the real draw here. The combat is well-executed, though unfortunately design decisions pertaining to world exploration, the control scheme, and the respawn system bring down the core experience. A very short game, [i]Titan Souls[/i] may be worth a try if it goes on sale.

The gameplay loop revolves around exploring a mysterious citadel until the player encounters one of the game's nearly two dozen bosses, and beating said bosses. Grouped according to the themes of the area of the world they're found in, e.g. ice or fire, bosses come at the player with ferocity, and the player must dispatch them quickly. Both player and boss fall to a single hit, leaving combat feeling both realistic and tense as you dodge roll until you're able to land the first strike. Naturally, bosses have an advantage since they're largely invulnerable, giving combat a puzzle element as the player must survive long enough to suss out the enemy's weak point.

Death is plentiful in [i]Titan Souls[/i], and players are revived at that world area's central hub. However, the hub is often 20-25 seconds away from the boss room, which eventually grows quite grating when boss battles can be as quick as a few seconds before dying to the first hit. In a proper [i]Dark Souls[/i] game, taking some time after dying to a boss to reflect on your encounter and consider your tactics makes sense - but those games feature health meters. Since [i]Titan Souls[/i] bosses have a single weakness to identify, combat more often hinges on twitch-action execution of a tactic rather than the discovery aspect. Thus the walk from spawn point to boss room is a waste of time; there should be an instant retry option.

The game features minimal controls. Offense is limited to a bow with one arrow; one button is dedicated to aiming/shooting/recovering the arrow, while the other button dodge rolls (which cancels attacks) and also runs. While such few controls make it possible to hypothetically play [i]Titan Souls[/i] on a single Switch Joycon, the crammed controls often lead to input error. You can only run after performing a dodge roll, leaving running a very risky maneuver for dodging attacks. Aiming the arrow one direction and subsequently dodge rolling another is also easy to misdirect. At the very least, there should be a dedicated run button.

The overworld contains the non-combat portions of [i]Titan Souls[/i]'s gameplay. The player must search across a mystical ruin with a few puzzles and some environmental storytelling. An atmospheric soundtrack and beautiful pixel art graphics make the world pleasing to explore, but the allure wears off eventually as the lack of a world map and a slow walking speed turn exploration into a chore, an obstacle annoyingly prolonging the wait to the next boss. Some NPCs or some worldbuilding could've made the exploration segments feel as important as the bosses, but without them one must wonder what's the point of having it at all.

[i]Titan Souls[/i] is essentially a Pixel Art 2D Soulslike Boss Rush. The boss fights themselves are well designed and satisfying, though the forced waits between deaths and the exploration segments drag out what is otherwise a very short game. Clocking in at just around three hours spent on a full run, prospective players should weigh how interested they are in replaying the game on higher difficulties to get more out of the experience. Regardless, this is a decent game, though maybe one worth waiting for a sale. [i]Titan Souls[/i] gets a C+.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025146573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1645973602}
review:
I didn't get all that far into the game, so these are just my impressions of the early bits.

Visuals are fine and the music is good.

The gameplay feels like if someone looked vaguely at old 2D Zelda boss fights and went "what if we make a whole game that's nothing but boss fights, but every boss is a puzzle that instakills you if you slip up even once, and you only get a single recoverable arrow and a dodge move?", at which point you then have to run all the way from the nearest save point to start the fight all over again.
Sure, it was not overly difficult to figure out the gimmick of each boss so far, but it doesn't really feel like a fight if that makes sense.

It also gives you this somewhat long and elaborate animation with light beams after you kill an enemy but that doesn't seem to actually do anything as far as I can tell? So far, the game doesn't explain anything whatsoever, which makes me feel like I would rather skip the animation and leave immediately.

There's certainly going to be an audience for this kind of game, but it's probably not going to be very big. Even old school NES era games or the instakill Shinobi games feel less punishing than this somehow, maybe because they don't give you such an extremely limited way to deal with enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015344213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1681084732}
review: I really like this game. Its very simple and very challenging. Usually not a fan of the older art styles and 2d games but I really enjoyed it in this game, maybe I should give more a try. 2 or 3 of the bosses seem to be fine-line rng to beat, theres probably something I didn't notice in these bosses but after spending close to an hour on them each I really didn't notice an obvious weakness/pattern that needed to be exploited to beat those few bosses. Pretty much had to brute force/rng luck those bosses to beat em. Other than that I thoroughly enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071713583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1645748870}
review:
Terrible.
The whole point of a challenging Souls-like or Metroidvania game is that you can explore, maybe uncover a story, challenge yourself, and actually get into the game enough to want to continue when you hit a hard boss.

With Titan Souls, it's just immediately "go fight these bosses". Why? Who cares, just do it. That's not fun. I have zero investment in this game's story, why would I immediately put in an hour fighting the titans right at the very beginning?

author: {'steamid': '76561198207084867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1645673947}
review: No creo que este juego sea para mucha gente, en lo personal lo encontrÃ© tedioso y frustrante. La razones por las que me pareciÃ³ este juego asÃ­ son varias: los escenarios no estan bien diseÃ±ados, es decir, no identificas al instante la profundidad, altura, longuitud de los mismo; por otro lado tiene un escenario innecesariamente y molestamente grande, un mapa grande que tardas en recorrer y es facil perderse; por otro lado cada que mueres eres teletransportado a una plataforma hasta la chingada de la puerta que te lleva al jefe y como moriras mucho no pararas de andar caminando el mismo maldito camino vacio y gigante; por otro lado, el gameplay es muy aburrido en cuanto al jugador, corres, evades y atacas, para matar a los jefes tienes que analiza su patron de ataque y planear como atacarle en su punto debil, el problema es que sus patrones son caoticos y muy rapidos, apenas te da tiempo de reaccionar, por lo que moriras mucho en agarrarle la onda (a menos que seas un crack), y eso significa caminar inutilmente acada rato, de igual manera aunque ya tenga la debilidad y estrategia para matar el jefe, dado lo rapidos y caoticos que son llevar a cabo esa estrategia no es facil de lograr. Otra cosa, puzzles de mierda que solo te quitan tiempo al igual que las infinitas caminatas. Otra cosa, el maldito control, el apuntado para moverte y disparar no se siente bien. He jugado juegos de este estilo y me han gustado pero este simplemente me parece frustrante y tedioso, hasta el punto que me dio dolor de cabeza

author: {'steamid': '76561198217773051', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1645553971}
review:
Se DarkSouls avesse fatto sesso passivo e di gruppo non a scopo riproduttivo o ludico con TheBindingOfIsaac e Minecraft in 2D, probabilmente dalla gravidanza indesiderata verrebbe fuori questo titolo.

Pregi:
- La Musica
- La Grafica pixelart

Difetti: 
- Arroganza.
- Gameplay ignobile che fa il verso a Celeste, The Binding of Isaac, Super Meat Boy e SpeedRunners, fallendo miseramente nel tentativo di intrattenere.
- Poca longevitÃ , la storia si completa in due ore e mezza.
- Achivements Buggati, non possono essere ottenuti nella versione Mac/Linux del gioco.
- Meccanica delle invasioni alla DarkSouls buggata.
- Elogi alle comunitÃ  LGBTQ in quanto la protagonista Ã¨ dichiaratamente dell'altra sponda e fa continui riferimenti all'Onanismo femminile allundendo alle "Forbici".
- Impossibile chiedere il refund perchÃ© lo sviluppatore ha cambiato mail di contatto e Valve continua a vendere il gioco nonostante le segnalazioni.

Voto: 3/10 praticamente Ã¨ uno scam

author: {'steamid': '76561198054915862', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1645289464}
review:
Meh... for a souls-like game it's basic. The only creative thing is the one shot kill everything.

It's fun for like 20min and then it's the same thing over and over and I got bored.
The most annoying thing is going back to a boss room.

Also has bugs were the arrow gets stuck on terrain and you cant recover it, and if you enter a new room it shoots backwards like a milimetre and it get's stuck forever. Annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561199082667949', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1645190604}
review: Kind of difficult, but I really love that the bosses are technically short. They usually take a single hit, sometimes two. The bosses last a little bit since you'll die a few times, but a winning battle is usually around 10 to 30 seconds long while the rest of the time comes from dying over and over while you try to figure out how to beat the boss. Something that really bugged me was having to walk back to the boss after dying. The spawn point is usually not too far from the boss you just fought, but with how quick you can die I would prefer if I spawned right outside the boss rather than 10 to 15 seconds away. I did beat the game, but I believe there is more that I haven't done including a secret final boss. So it may be something I come back to, but not sure. Wasn't engaging enough to warrant me wanting to do it now at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347248587', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1610601589}
review:
Titan Souls does little, and does it WELL.
I've had the soundtrack on repeat for years, and the world is just such a joy to explore in between boss fights.
Those fights are the main focus of the game, and while they are super difficult, they are so rewarding to beat!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076577229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1644641164}
review:

The game also crashed to desktop when I beat the first boss.

0/10, literal shovelware.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976837296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1644602067}
review:
The boss fights vary from difficult-but-fun to frustrating, but overall they're good. The problem though is that everything else feels like bloat. Wandering around the map to find the next set of boss fights is *very* slow, and the checkpoints are almost always annoyingly far from the boss fights. If you respawned at the entrance to the fight when you died, then it would be fine to die 20x or more on a boss, but when you spend more time walking back to the arena through an utterly empty map than you do actually fighting the boss, then dying and retrying is just boring.

Spend your money on Death's Door instead. It's by the same devs and it's very good.

review:
Mind numblingly hard but satisfying. Although limited as a game with not much to it other than bosses and a tiny bit of exploration it's still worth it if you want a top down Dark Souls-esk game. I got it because I played and adored their sequel "Death's Door" and this one was supposed to be connected. 
I'm glad they made the sequel easier because this game kicked my butt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981180543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1644186384}
review:
This game is a pretty unique concept. One arrow, on hit you are dead, but same with most bosses. And the only thing you do is kill bosses. Some of them were quite easy, and I would down them on attempt one or two. Some took 10 attempts. I didn't die as much as I thought I would. Some of the fights get frustrating, and it would have been nice to start at the entrance to the fight, so as not to have to walk back, but it was a minor inconvenience.

There is no story to the game, which is odd. There is literally no explanation as to what you are doing or why. Which is kinda weird, since the level design is neat and clearly there is some missing backstory. It could have been fleshed out a little and it would have been a much better product. I watched some interpretation videos, and they were neat. I think a bit of text other than the one monologue in the game could have tied the game together nicely.

The style of the pixel art, while crude in some ways, is very nice in others. The sound is basic, but the music is quite good. Which is ironic because you barely get to hear some of the boss fight music due to one of you killing the other very quickly.

Overall, this is an okay game. There are a lot of achievements to get, which I am not interested in. I got the actual ending, which was kinda lame and ambiguous, though this makes sense as so is the rest of the game. It took me less than three hours to accomplish this, and while it's fun, it's not worth the asking price. It was on a drastic sale, and I had just finished Death's Door (which was great), so I figured I'd pick this up. While it was worth a few bucks, not worth it not on sale.

review:

Niby nic nadzwyczajnego, lecz produkcja potrafi nie tylko zaskoczyÄ‡ a nawet daÄ‡ solidnie w koÅ›Ä‡ graczowi co ucieszy nie jednego weterana tego gatunku.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]

Jak juÅ¼ zdoÅ‚aÅ‚em nadmieniÄ‡ na samym poczÄ…tku tej recenzji, mamy tym razem do czynienia z tytuÅ‚em z kategorii gier przygodowych wzorujÄ…cy siÄ™ mocno na grach typu soulslike i odczuwalnie jest kierowany dla tego typu odbiorcÃ³w. 

W powyÅ¼szej produkcji gracz wciela siÄ™ w mÅ‚odego wojownika, ktÃ³rego zadaniem bÄ™dzie eksploracja tajemniczego Å›wiata gry w ktÃ³rym siÄ™ znajduje, rozwiÄ…zywanie pomniejszych logicznych zagadek jak i walka z tytuÅ‚owymi tytanami.

Pokonywanie owych tytanÃ³w stanowi gÅ‚Ã³wny filar tej gry, a unicestwienie ich stanowi nie lada wyzwanie. author: {'steamid': '76561198102764020', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1683573888}
review: Titan Souls is a simple yet difficult game reminiscent of Shadow of The Colossus and Dark Souls. While this game have little to none to do outside of combat I think it hammers home the simplicity that it's trying to go for. I'd say my biggest gripe with it is that there isn't enough titans (18 total) because of the concept: titans die in one hit but you do as well, finishing the game left me wanting more titans to fight. Overall this game is easy to pick up and hard to master and I find myself coming back to it to try it again to master the simple yet difficult encounters of Titan Souls.

review: Uma palavra descreve esse jogo completamente: IncrÃ­vel! Esse jogo foi feito para aqueles que querem uma experiÃªncia desafiadora ambientada de forma extremamente bonita e cativante, mas principalmente difÃ­cil, eu levei muito tempo para matar realmente todos os titans no modo normal e nem me ouso a aventurar nos outros modos, mas recomendo a vocÃª que gosta de se estressar e ir alÃ©m a comprar e jogar este joga, quem platina esse tipo de jogo nÃ£o Ã© humano e sim um Deus. Recomendo a qualquer um para sair um pouco da caixa tambÃ©m, perfeita a experiÃªncia, com trilha sonora muito bem feita acompanhada de uma arte muito bonita, mais uma vez vez joguem Ã© incrÃ­vel!

review: Jogo dificil pra porra, bati final no PS4 pois estava em promo e aqui tbm estava entao vale mt a pena, Trilha sonora viciante e mt intrigante a histÃ³ria estilo Dark Souls, onde vc n entende porra nenhuma mas entende.

author: {'steamid': '76561198995903060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1644037419}
review: Unless you speed-run Dark Souls for lunch, this is likely not for you. I tried liking it but after playing for nearly 5 hours, this is pretty much all I got: a very hard game by default, that doesn't even tell you what's going on or why you're doing what you're doing. At least as far as I got, which, well, not far. Not recommended for the average, casual gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039217370', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1643761231}
review: A good game. Pure boss rush, think Cuphead minus the run n' gun stages. However, Titan Souls can veer more towards frustrating than challenging thanks to the first few encounters with a boss being very punishing. You die in one hit. Learning a boss' patterns is a lot of trial and error, and when you die you are spawned back at a checkpoint just far enough away that you will spend ten or so seconds running back towards it. This can add up, especially if you are stuck on a boss and dying repeatedly. Ultimately though it sounds worse than it really is. There were only one or two bosses were I was really fed up of dying and having to run back. For the most part you will kill the boss in fifteen tries or so, so usually the checkpoint system does add a nice tense feeling to the fights. Each boss itself is unique and plays completely different. The overworld is very pretty and has some few interesting elements, but it is mostly empty and lacking cool things to explore. The music is fantastic. Overall, a good game to play if you enjoy a challenging enough time, it's not too-too hard and you can beat it relatively quickly comparet to other boss rush games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215255631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1645222279}
review:
Es un juego minimalista con buenas ideas. Titan Souls es una boss rush, tu objetivo solamente es derrotar titanes, pero la mecÃ¡nica sobre el combate es lo que lo hace mas interesante! Tienes un arco y una sola flecha, todos los jefes son derrotados de un solo disparo en su punto dÃ©bil, pero tu tambiÃ©n te mueres de un golpe. Tienes que ser paciente y buscar el momento preciso para poder disparar al punto dÃ©bil, mientras esperas ese momento vas a tener que esquivar y evitar cada uno de los ataques de estos enemigos. 

Titan Souls esta bien, su banda sonora realmente es algo que hace especial el juego en sus batallas, la dificultad dirÃ­a que es un tema de adaptarse al momento, pero nunca es injusto. Lo recomiendo a precio de oferta!

PD: NO lo juegues con teclado, es lo peor que podrÃ­as hacer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276127901', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1643236167}
review:
The game's pretty interesting, really. You die in one hit, so does the boss, have fun bashing your head into the wall until you breach. It's honestly a style that irritates me in a good way, purely from the spiteful catharsis of putting down a titan that was giving me grief, and the mechanics are simple & solid enough to last for what's feeling to be a short runtime.

Shame that the game physically feels like said wall-to-head bashing at times. There's a large amount of screen shake and every boss kill rewards you with pure, blinding white with loud ambiance noise; neither of these can be turned off, neither of these had any warning at all, and I can see this being a barrier to anyone who's epileptic and might actually suffer immediate and possibly lethal health issues from these aesthetic choices. I was enjoying my time, but the game's video choice is very literally painful to me and forced me to put it down almost as fast as I had begun playing.

Overall I'd recommend, unless you're prone to seizures or migraines. Those two stipulations will definitely kill the game for you, if not just kill you outright as you play.

review: No me ha parecido gran cosa, muy repetitivo, solo tienes jefes, mueren en un golpe, pero tu tambien mueres instantaneamente, solo tienes una flecha a recoger y lanzar, y tienes posibilidad de rodar pero limitado ya que debe pasar mas menos como un segundo antes de ejecutar la siguiente voltereta para esquivar. Se nota que esta pensado para repetir y repetir los jefes hasta que una flecha suelta les impacte en el punto debil porque recarga despues de cada muerte al momento, porque el juego apenas te da opciÃ³n de observar golpes, un descuido y vuelta a empezar desde el primer hasta el ultimo jefe, y la mayoria de muertes la primera vez las acabas haciendo mÃ¡s por suerte que por habilidad. Lo recomiendo con rebaja y tampoco es muy largo, si no teneis mejor shadow of the colossus en consolas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054547173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1642726471}
review:
If you played Ghostrunner then you've seen how to properly implement a one-shot protagonist. You died? You can retry in the same second. Here? Each time I die I have like 2 seconds of black screen, then I have to walk back to the titan's door which is like another 5 seconds (during which god damned stairs make my roll bump, because somebody thought it was a great idea to put resources into making this particular part realistic), and  you can die within the next 2 seconds if you're too careless/want to do things too fast. The last one could be called me being bad but the bosses are designed so that you WILL die, because the only way to work out what you need to do is trial and error, which is fine but only if you do it like in Ghostrunner: you died, half a second later you're back in action.

Maybe I'll try this game again sometime later, but for now I'm mad. And good frustrating games don't give you  time to be  mad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121355753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1642730928}
review: I bought this game years ago because it looked pretty, and at the time  I wasn't 100% on it. Visiting it years later I've realized this game has grown on me. Reminds me of an early version of Cuphead. It' super challenging, fun, and never cheats you from victory. Every accomplished fight makes you feel overjoyed and satisfied. Does it suck to die in 1 hit? Yes. Does it suck to have to walk all the way back to each boss? Yes. But it's absolutely fair and balanced in that way. If you like Cuphead, or even just boss gauntlet games in general this is for you.
